programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple of ex-pats attempt to run a new fishing charter, two B&B owners in France face their biggest challenge yet, and on the Costa Blanca, a family pulls together to try and rescue a Spanish dream home.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Estate agent couple Sharon and Steve Garner seek a villa home in southern Spain for a retired teacher, while a Rochdale family hopes to find a new beginning in Alicante.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert helps two homeowners in West Yorkshire. In Fixby, Huddersfield, Jean is desperate to sell her house, which has been on the market for 13 months, but the strange layout of the interior is matched only by her eccentric taste in decor. In Queensbury, Bradford, retired teacher Mary's cottage has lost its country charm and become too expensive for her to keep. Can Phil help make their properties more attractive to buyers?.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Gina Butler, the founder of one of America's most successful bakeries, dons a disguise to go incognito among her employees, posing as a contestant on a reality show. Gina is heavily involved in the creation of every recipe for the cupcakes sold in her stores and is keen to ensure each franchise is consistent in meeting her perfectionist standards.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steven Newman, CEO of department store chain Loehmann's, views his company from a different perspective when he goes undercover as an aspiring entrepreneur visiting the shops after winning a reality TV contest - and learns first-hand that the employees are the foundation of the company.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts with a less-than-romantic relationship and a pair of dinner party veterans are among the contestants taking part in the culinary challenge in Sussex.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Northamptonshire, loved-up luvvies Anna and Coylah hope their menu will reflect their personalities, while Felicity and Lawrence, and Martin and Dawn also compete.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Sushi Ko, a Japanese restaurant in California that is losing up to $20,000 a month. Gordon finds owner and chef Akira lacking in confidence and self-esteem as the strain of an empty business is beginning to take its toll on his relationship with this family.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three previous restaurants he tried to save - Handlebar, Casa Roma and the Black Pearl - to find out whether his advice has been put to good use.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple cannot decide whether to buy a property in Surrey or France. While Andy wants to cross the Channel and find a project to tackle in Saint-Cyprien on the Mediterranean coast, partner Jo would rather stay close to her friends and family in the UK.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer guide more prospective property buyers through the complex world of viewings and agents. They begin in Cambridgeshire, where they help Chris and Louise find their dream home in a rural setting, while also looking at properties in Cambridge for a pair of doctors and first-time buyers.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel and his team face an emergency when a black Labrador is rushed in after being hit by a car. The pioneering vets also treat a cocker spaniel with a bulging disc in its spine and a basset hound that needs its leg straightening. But the dog is also overweight, so the professor insists it be put on a diet.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: An elephant calf, Indali, is born at Chester Zoo, but her young half-sister Nandita doesn't welcome the new arrival. Meanwhile, Bush dog dad Franco is under pressure as his family grows, and Apple, an onager - a rare type of wild horse - faces a major operation.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The eagle-eyed armchair critics share their opinions on Schofield's South African Adventure, Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway, Dogs Behaving Badly, Down the Mighty River with Steve Backshall, The Replacement, The Great Pottery Throw Down and the News. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Twenty-year-old Antonio is rushed to A&E after a motorcycle accident leaves him with a severe fracture to his leg and the medical team are concerned about a potential arterial bleed. Meanwhile, doctors investigate the damage to the chest and lungs of 40-year-old Karen, who fell off her horse, which then trampled on her, while leukaemia patient Hayley, 29, comes to St George's with wife Emma after suffering an infection and low immune system.(n)

programme.title: How'd You Get So Rich
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan meets a man who made his fortune running gay bars, an American couple who got rich designing an app and now travel the world for free and a former Mafia boss who these days earns his money as a preacher.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and David Mitchell compete against Jon Richardson and Katherine Ryan. The Brett Domino Trio join Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Newbury Park in southern California to help Mexican restaurant Mama Rita's. The owner previously ran a successful catering company but has struggled to adapt her skills to meet the demands of a new business - and with a year's worth of food stored in the freezer Gordon realises he has a tough job ahead.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Todd Pedersen, CEO and founder of Vivint, a leading solar and home security business, based in Utah, goes undercover among his own workforce posing as a contestant on a reality show. He's proud to head an organisation that provides a fun and relaxed work environment, but now that the company is offering smart home technology, it's in competition with much larger organisations, and Todd wants to make sure it's fully prepared to take them on.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Ian and Jane Crang from West Sussex search for a family home in Almeria in Spain, while Damian from Belfast looks for an apartment in Alicante on the Costa Blanca.(n)

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: The owners of a vineyard open a pop-up restaurant, but there are some last-minute nerves, while two B&B proprietors host an unusual event in a bid to boost takings. In Spain, a wannabe fishing captain has to learn the ropes.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Former London cabbie Bernie Kerslake and his wife Margaret have been holidaying in Spain for decades and now they want to set up home there.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert helps mother-of-four Pam in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, whose semi-detached home has been languishing on the market for a year. He also visits David's cottage in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, with dated decor, a bare kitchen and a garden that resembles a jungle. Can Phil make these houses more attractive to buyers?.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Courtland Gray prepares to takeover as CEO of Peavey Electronics by donning a disguise to go incognito among the company's staff to learn how the frontline employees really feel.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jane Grote Abell, the Chairwoman of Donatos Pizza and daughter of the company's founder, poses as a contestant on a reality TV show who is trying to win money to open her own restaurant. Her aim is to uncover where the company is going, what plans for the future should include and whether her father's values are still being upheld.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples compete for the cash prize in and around Nottingham - young lovebirds Gabz and Pete, opinionated Sushma and Gulab, and country-dwelling partners John and Shaun.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The cooking contest moves to South Yorkshire, where the first pair present a Michael Jackson-inspired menu, followed by evenings hosted by Sam and Rosie, and Ian and Lorraine.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits California, where his job is to help the owner of Lido Di Manhattan. Lisa Marie Hemmat, an ambitious business school graduate, has been running the restaurant for the past five years, but has failed to exert any control over the kitchen and the menu. The chef tries to teach her the basics of cooking and venue management, but trouble brews when her staff threaten to walk out on relaunch night.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef revisits two restaurants, Giuseppi's and Sante La Brea, to find out whether the owners took his advice on how to raise standards. Plus, an update on Finn McCool's.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman meet Hampshire couple Eric and Maria, who are looking to find a retirement home but have different ideas about where to relocate. They are split between settling in Romsey, where they will be closer to friends and family, or finding a home in Collioure, France.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo

programme.title: Hidden Restaurants with Michel Roux Jr
programme.desc: Michel's journey brings him to the West Country and Wales, as he searches for secret eateries and food mavericks in remote and often bizarre places. On his travels he discovers hidden restaurants inside a garden shed, a staff canteen and a Victorian walled kitchen garden, before visiting a highly-celebrated crab shack. Later, Michel travels to London with his friend and chef Freddy Bird, and the pair meet a couple who want to turn an old barge into a fine-dining fish restaurant on the Isles of Scilly.(n)

programme.title: The Royal House of Windsor
programme.desc: The fifth installment of the series focuses on the life and tragic death of Diana, Princess of Wales. Her huge personality and celebrity status challenged the Windsors, culminating in the famous 1995 Panorama interview that prompted the Queen to demand Prince Charles to divorce Diana. After her tragic death, the House of Windsor was shaken, but she left an enduring legacy in the form of her two sons.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The eagle-eyed armchair critics share their opinions on Schofield's South African Adventure, Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway, Dogs Behaving Badly, Down the Mighty River with Steve Backshall, The Replacement, The Great Pottery Throw Down and the News. programme.title: Mutiny
programme.desc: Nine men recreate a voyage by William Bligh in 1789, when he and his loyal crewmen crossed 4,000 miles of the Pacific ocean from Tonga to Timor after being cast adrift from HMS Bounty by mutinying officers and left for dead. SAS: Who Dares Wins chief instructor Anthony Middleton is in charge of a crew of eight made up of sailors and complete novices, attempting the journey in a replica 23ft open wooden boat, with similar equipment and the same rations of food and water that Bligh's men had.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: Documentary telling the stories of people struggling to live on state welfare, something made all the more difficult by their individual battles with the bulge. Blossom lives in Brighton and has various health problems. Now she has discovered she many have cervical cancer and needs exploratory surgery - but at 25 stone, doctors have told her she is too fat to go under general anaesthetic. In Bexhill, Gina and Gary claim more than £10,000 a year in benefits. Gina has always been big but now she worries she has symptoms of diabetes. Archie near Manchester tips the scales at 26 stone and hasn't had a full-time job for six years. However, for four weeks of the year he earns money dressing up as Father Christmas.(n)

Fortunately, a surgeon in America heard of her plight and offered to help. Cameras follows Zara and her family as they cope with lipodystrophy, the condition that affects them all.(n)

Quentin Tarantino's Oscar-winning Western, starring Jamie Foxx, Christoph Waltz, Leonardo DiCaprio and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: In America
programme.desc: An aspiring Irish actor and his family illegally immigrate in the United States with the dreams of the father breaking into the New York City theatrical scene. Once they arrive in the big city, they move into a flop house and try to make it truly their home. While they struggle to fit in their new country, the family finds new friends like the reclusive neighbour, Mateo, who provide help in the most unexpected ways in America(n)

programme.title: Sea of Love
programme.desc: A veteran detective's search for a serial killer yields a seductive suspect(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: The lighthearted story of an unlikely angel who drinks, smokes and has a large pair of wings. His first appearance in rural Iowa causes a stir and attracts the interest of two jaded journalists and a self-proclaimed angel expert - all of whom expect the angel to be a fraud(n)

programme.title: Solaris
programme.desc: Steven Soderbergh's remake of the classic Andrei Torkovsky film stars George Clooney as the therapist sent to mentor a group of astronauts on the Prometheus space station, where the remaining crew are both locked in their own fears, speaking of visions of lost loved ones. At first sceptical, when Clooney's lost wife appears to him, he begins to wonder what influence the mysterious planet Solaris has on the human psyche(n)

programme.title: I Love You, Man
programme.desc: On the verge of getting married, real estate agent Peter Klaven realises he doesn't have any close pals. Setting out to find a best man, he befriends amiable slacker Sydney Fife, but spends so much time with his new buddy that the wedding is put in jeopardy. Comedy(n)

programme.title: The Man From U.N.C.L.E.
programme.desc: Adaptation of the TV series set in the 1960s, detailing the first pairing of American agent Napoleon Solo with Russian operative Illya Kuryakin(n)

programme.title: Ghost World
programme.desc: Two highschool friends,Enid and Rebecca, on the verge of leaving their adolescence behind, try to decide what to do with their lives.Enid discovers a kindred spirit in fellow misfit Seymour, who shares her disgust with the world around them(n)

programme.title: Juno
programme.desc: (2007) Jason Reitman's comedy drama stars Oscar-nominee Ellen Page as Juno McGuff, 16 and pregnant after an encounter with sometime boyfriend Paulie Bleeker (Michael Cera). She tells her father Mac and stepmother Bren (JK Simmons and Allison Janney) she intends to have the baby and then hand it over for adoption. In the pages of the PennySaver, she finds childless couple Vanessa and Mark Loring (Jennifer Garner and Jason Bateman) who look like the ideal couple. But, as the months progress and her stomach swells, Juno begins to doubt both them and her course of action. Oscar-winning Diablo Cody's whip-smart script keeps the laughs coming and the action moving in one of the most lauded movies of recent years(n)

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: Three bored New England women lament the gap in their lives. In steps the devilish Jack Nicholson, who turns everything upside down. A strong cast, cracking story from the novel by John Updike and a sharp turn by Nicholson on his very worst behaviour(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: The aristocratic daughter of Lord Croft takes on her old man's archaeological mantle, battling the Illuminati, a sinister crew bent on discovering an ancient relic which will enable them to control time. Hi-tech adventure with a leading lady who's at the top of her game(n)

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: A highway shunt between lawyer Gavin Banek and divorcee Doyle Gipson turns nasty. Banek, late for court, flees the scene. Gipson arrives late too - and finds out he's lost access to his kids. To his mind, it's Banek's fault and he's going to pay. Thriller(n)

programme.title: Head of State
programme.desc: When a presidential candidate dies unexpectedly in the middle of the campaign, the Democratic party unexpectedly picks a Washington, D.C. alderman, Mays Gilliam, as his replacement(n)

programme.title: 27 Dresses
programme.desc: Jane loves planning weddings, but her flighty sister's ceremony is the ultimate challenge - she's marrying the man Jane secretly loves. A cynical marriage columnist surreptitiously writing a human-interest story about the girl with a closet full of bridesmaid dresses further complicates Jane's life(n)

programme.title: I Love You, Man
programme.desc: On the verge of getting married, real estate agent Peter Klaven realises he doesn't have any close pals. Setting out to find a best man, he befriends amiable slacker Sydney Fife, but spends so much time with his new buddy that the wedding is put in jeopardy. Comedy(n)

programme.title: Life Is Beautiful
programme.desc: In this WW II tragicomedy, famed Italian funnyman Roberto Benigni (The Monster) portrays Guido, who moves during the '30s from the country to a Tuscan town, where he is entranced by schoolteacher Dora (Nicoletta Braschi, Benigni's real-life wife). Dora likes Guido, but she remains faithful to her pompous fiancé, so Guido has an uphill struggle. Meanwhile, anti-Semitic attitudes lead to attacks against Guido's Jewish uncle (Giustino Durano). Leaping ahead to five years later, during WW II, Guido and Dora are married and have a son Giosue (Giorgio Cantarini). After they are imprisoned in a concentration camp, Guido goes to elaborate lengths to keep his son from understanding the truth of their situation. He tells the boy that they are competing with others to win an armored tank -- so everything from food shortages to tattoos is explained as necessary for participation in the contest(n)

programme.title: Run Fatboy Run
programme.desc: This winning romp is the assured big-screen directorial debut of David Schwimmer ("Friends"). Simon Pegg is a scream as an English layabout who goes to great lengths to win back the pregnant woman (Thandie Newton) he abandoned on their wedding day five years earlier. Swiftly paced and exuberantly acted, the rom-com costars Hank Azaria as Newton's new beau, a devoted American hedge-fund manager who run marathons. Pegg co-wrote the script with Michael Ian Black. Dylan Moran, Matthew Fenton(n)

programme.title: Inventing the Abbotts
programme.desc: A light-hearted story of two brothers courting three sisters(n)

programme.title: Ghost
programme.desc: After being killed during a botched mugging, a man's love for his partner enables him to remain on earth as a ghost(n)

programme.title: Say Anything...
programme.desc: Touching teenage romantic comedy drama about a middling high-school student who fails for a brilliant, beautiful, and reputedly unattainable classmate and gradually wins her over. The obstacle he can't seem to overcome is her father, who has great plans for the girl and does not want to see her diverted from her educational goals because of a relationship with a loser(n)

programme.title: Mr. Deeds
programme.desc: Goofy comedy set in New York about a pizzeria owner who inherits a vast fortune from a distant relative. However, the dead man's unscrupulous former associates are determined to part the small-town simpleton from his newly acquired wealth. Meanwhile, a beautiful reporter is sent to get the inside track on the man's story by pretending to fall in love with him(n)

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: Tongue-in-cheek horror tale in which a small Nevada desert town is terrorised by giant man-eating worms. Two handymen are forced to postpone their plans to escape their humdrum lives after several mysterious deaths and a series of earthquakes turn out to be the work of predatory subterranean creatures which lay siege to the terrified townsfolk(n)

programme.title: Hostage
programme.desc: A failed police negotiator turned small town cop, must save the lives of a family held hostage, which draws him into a much more dangerous situation(n)

programme.title: Executive Decision
programme.desc: A 747 travelling from Athens to Washington DC is hijaked by a group of terrorists. They claim it's to force the government to release their leader, but covert intelligence man David Grant doesn't believe it. He tries to persuade the authorities to keep the plane out of US airspace while a rescue mission is put together. This mission involves the use of a high tech plane(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Two years after saving the world with the Autobots, Sam Witwicky is heading off to university when an ancient Decepticon named The Fallen returns to Earth seeking revenge. Their home planet of Cybertron rendered uninhabitable, the Autobots begin working with the military to hunt down any remaining Decepticons. Meanwhile, Sam and Mikaela race to unlock the secret history of the Transformers on Earth in order to save the planet from the most-formidable Decepticon to date(n)

programme.title: Platoon
programme.desc: The diary of a green Vietnam GI shows the realities of that conflict as soldiers fight enemies, including bugs, C-rations, jungle rot, marijuana and a demoralized sergeant, as well as the Vietcong(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Longmire
programme.desc: Walt investigates a rape on the reservation which stirs up tension between the oil rig workers and the Cheyennes. Vic moves in with Cady after being evicted from her home. During the investigation, Walt's new deputy Zachary Heflin acquits himself well, but Ferg inadvertently sends away two witnesses who saw Gabriella fleeing the scene.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A dispute over a pair of trousers missing from a dry cleaner's ends in murder - and the ensuing investigation leads Lupo and Green to a businessman working for a shady multinational chain of department stores. Drama, starring Jesse L Martin and Jeremy Sisto.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Lupo and Green are called to the scene after a white teenage boy and a black girl are killed in a shooting near a neighbourhood playground. However, progress is slow when the detectives find locals unwilling to talk about the events, but two brothers who were friends of the murdered boy point them towards a suspect. Jeremy Sisto and Jesse L Martin star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: A man is shot dead during an apparent carjacking and the team identifies him as Paul Tortucci, who ran a pizza place with his uncle Raphael. It appears that the victim had been smuggling contraband goods in his truck and the detectives believe that the killers had their sights set on retrieving a shipment of drugs from the vehicle - but the illegal cargo is not what the CSIs or the criminals expect. Crime drama, with Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a lance corporal, whose body has been found in an empty house, and discovers he had a number of spurned lovers and a $2million inheritance. Ducky and Gibbs interview one of the dead marine's partners, but disagree over whether she is telling the truth. David McCallum and Mark Harmon star.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Drama following the fortunes of Olivia Lockhart, a small-town judge, both inside and away from the courtroom. As the tale gets under way, Olivia considers a career move that could cost her a new romance, and force her to leave behind the home she has come to love.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Green comes under investigation by Internal Affairs after he shoots a suspect, and the case reveals a host of secrets the detective would rather keep hidden, threatening not only his police career but his freedom. Jesse L Martin stars, alongside S Epatha Merkerson and Linus Roache.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A novelist's apparent suicide becomes a murder case, with the evidence leading Lupo and his new partner Kevin Bernard to suspect a secretive religious group. Award-winning police drama, starring Jeremy Sisto and Anthony Anderson.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Three women dressed identically as the Breakfast at Tiffany's character Holly Golightly rob a jewellery store and kill a salesman in the process, triggering an inquiry that leads the team into the murky world of illicit diamond trading. Meanwhile, Mac and Peyton investigate the discovery of a mummified corpse in a condemned building. Forensic drama, starring Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tries to find out who was responsible for sabotaging a robotic vehicle that caused the death of a Navy lieutenant and almost killed Abby. Meanwhile, Ziva's suspicions are aroused by the discovery that Tony is repeatedly visiting the hospital. Drama, starring Pauley Perrette, Michael Weatherly, Cote de Pablo and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The discovery of a dead marine intelligence officer in a motel room sets the team off on a hunt for her killer. Although the town's authorities have allegedly already investigated the crime, Gibbs is determined to conduct his own thorough inquiries - which may lead him to a terrorist cell. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Reese is assigned to protect an NYPD analyst whose discovery of a software glitch has put him at risk from Samaritan, while Fusco has a narrow escape.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler investigate after Larissa Welsh's boyfriend returns home to find her unconscious, tied to a chair, covered in razor cuts and wearing nothing but some underwear labelled `Brandy', before a naked man jumps out and attacks him. Back at headquarters, Munch and Fin search for similar cases and discover two girls have been attacked in the same manner, and further evidence points toward the existence of a paedophile ring. Guest starring Taryn Manning (Orange Is the New Black, Hawaii Five-0).(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and Benson investigate the rape of Debbie Shields in her home and are approached by Captain Jackson, who is the father of the victim's partner Ann and a psychiatrist specialising in treating sex addicts. A particular phrase used by the assailant strikes a chord with Jackson, but he refuses to say why due to doctor-patient confidentiality - and Stabler goes undercover at his rehabilitation clinic after there is a similar attack in Virginia. Guest starring Jeremy Irons.(n)

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: The firefighting drama returns after a mid-season break. Casey struggles with the injuries caused by his near-fatal accident, while Dawson enrols at the Fire Academy to find Severide is her instructor. New team member Allison hits it off with everyone except Shay, and Clarke remains silent during an interrogation over the murder of his wife's ex-boyfriend. What is he hiding?.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Adam and Danny are kidnapped and held hostage by a criminal who then orders his henchmen to launch an all-out attack on the crime lab in a bid to retrieve a cache of cocaine impounded by Flack. Trapped and outnumbered, Mac, Stella and Hawkes fight desperately for survival. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise and Eddie Cahill.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Having cleared himself of murdering crime boss Lou Gedda, Warrick is shot in a secluded alleyway. As the team rallies together to investigate the crime, suspicion falls on the police officer who tried to frame him for murder. However, evidence emerges that another corrupt cop could be at large.(n)

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Casey comes under pressure from a corrupt detective whose son caused a car crash that left a teenager paralysed. Severide has to fight off the advances of the Chief's new assistant, as well as dealing with the news he has a fractured vertebra in his neck that may never heal if he doesn't get treated.(n)

programme.title: Longmire
programme.desc: The sheriff's department investigates a highway incident in which one man has died and the other left injured. Meanwhile, Henry tries to bring the rapists to justice, Cady approaches Mathias about doing legal work for the reservation, and Walt hesitates about asking Dr Donna Sue Monahan for a date.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A politician is embroiled in a triple murder, but persuading him to reveal the truth is only the first step toward unmasking a killer willing to go to any lengths to avoid capture. Crime drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An investigation into a hit-and-run leads to a property scam, but Green, Rubirosa and Lupo's undercover work takes a surprising twist that pits McCoy against the US Attorney's office. January Jones (Mad Men) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: DB Russell heads to New York to help Mac search for his kidnapped girlfriend Christine, and James Boyd arranges to meet up with the gang to drop off the diamonds and release the hostages. With the CSI team monitoring his every movement, Boyd starts to ask too many questions and the captors begin to suspect he has involved the police. Conclusion of the two-part crossover between the Las Vegas and New York CSI franchises, starring Gary Sinise and Ted Danson.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Kidnappers strike on Halloween, wounding a marine sergeant and snatching his daughter - leaving the team members wondering why anyone would try to extort money from someone on such a modest salary. As the agents begin searching for a motive, Abby surprises everyone by turning up at the lab in a revealing fancy-dress costume.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Olivia comforts her best friend Grace when she is issued with divorce papers, and Justine makes a big decision when Warren reveals his plan to demolish the lighthouse and develop the land. Meanwhile, the owners of a local bed and breakfast decide to protest against the destruction and the case makes its way to Olivia's courtroom. Drama following the fortunes of a small-town judge, starring Andie MacDowell.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Debra Messing as New York homicide detective Laura Diamond, as she navigates juggling a difficult work and home life. In the opening episode, the police officer is called to help with a hostage situation, and discovers her twin boys have been expelled from their nursery.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A legal-aid strike leads first to murder, and then to Rubirosa pitting her wits against Cutter as the ADA tries to bring a case against a pro golfer accused of the killing of a paralegal. American legal drama, starring Alana De La Garza and Linus Roache.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Lupo and Bernard investigate the world of online romance when a garage mechanic is murdered, but the case takes a series of bizarre turns before they are able to identify the killer. Police drama, starring Anthony Anderson and Jeremy Sisto.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Danny and Lindsay investigate the murder of a woman at a promotional event for vodka and discover she was stabbed with an icicle, forcing the team to gather all the evidence before the clues melt. Mac and Stella examine the case of a runner found lying in a pool of his own blood during a marathon. Forensic drama, starring Gary Sinise and Carmine Giovinazzo.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A marine major is found dead in an underground maintenance room, having scratched out one of his own eyes - and the presence of a webcam suggests someone watched him die. The team investigates with the help of Lt Col Hollis Mann, and links the case to wanted terrorist Mamoun Sharif, an old adversary who is threatening to unleash a chemical attack.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents try to track down an arms dealer who has the launch codes for the Navy's encrypted satellite defence system and is offering them to the highest bidder. programme.title: Rocky II
programme.desc: The Italian Stallion returns for a rematch with Apollo Creed, hoping, finally, to capture the heavyweight title(n)

programme.title: Gladiator
programme.desc: Award-winning action drama, set in Roman times, about a once-powerful general who is forced to become a gladiator. The death of Marcus Aurelius sees his devious son Commodus replace him as emperor, and he immediately orders the execution of his father's favourite general, Maximus. As the couple's anxiety rises and an icy realisation sets in, the pair's perfect home quickly turns into a nightmare(n)

programme.title: Saving Private Ryan
programme.desc: Oscar-winning World War II drama combining the story of an unusual rescue mission with an overwhelmingly powerful re-creation of the D-Day landings. In the fictional story, unfolded against impressive action sequences, a group of American soldiers is dispatched to locate one man among thousands - a US private whose three brothers have all been killed in action. The powers that be want to send him home to his family(n)

programme.title: Forrest Gump
programme.desc: Two-time Academy Award winner Tom Hanks stars alongside Sally Field and Robin Wright in this multi-Oscar winning blockbuster. The story follows the life of low I.Q. Forrest Gump and his meeting with the love of his life Jenny Curran. The film chronicles his accidental experiences with some of the most important people and events in America from the late 1950s through the 1970s including a meeting with Elvis Presley, JFK, Lyndon Johnson, Richard Nixon, fighting in Vietnam, etc. The problem is, he's too stupid to realize the significance of his actions. Forrest becomes representative of the baby boomer generation having walked through life blindly. Starring Tom Hanks, Sally Field and Robin Wright(n)

programme.title: The Departed
programme.desc: Legendary director Martin Scorsese takes the helm for this tale of questionable loyalties and blurring identities set in the South Boston organized crime scene and inspired by the wildly popular 2002 Hong Kong crime film Infernal Affairs. As the police force attempts to reign in the increasingly powerful Irish mafia, authorities are faced with the prospect of sending in an undercover agent or seeing their already frail grip on the criminal underworld slip even further. Billy Costigan (Leonardo DiCaprio) is a young cop looking to make a name for himself in the world of law enforcement. Collin Sullivan (Matt Damon) is a street-smart criminal who has successfully infiltrated the police department with the sole intention of reporting their every move to ruthless syndicate head Frank Costello (Jack Nicholson). When Costigan is assigned the task of working his way into Costello's tightly guarded inner circle, Sullivan is faced with the responsibility of rooting out the informer before things get out of hand. With the stakes constantly rising and time quickly running out for the undercover cop and his criminal counterpart, each man must work feverishly to reveal his counterpart before his identity is exposed by the other. Martin Sheen, Alec Baldwin, and Ray Winstone co-star, and writer William Monahan adapts a screenplay originally penned by Alan Mak and Felix Chong(n)

programme.title: Executive Decision
programme.desc: A 747 travelling from Athens to Washington DC is hijaked by a group of terrorists. They claim it's to force the government to release their leader, but covert intelligence man David Grant doesn't believe it. He tries to persuade the authorities to keep the plane out of US airspace while a rescue mission is put together. This mission involves the use of a high tech plane(n)

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: The sleepy appearance of an Appalachian coal-mining community belies the presence of a sinister toxic waste-dumping scheme that is poisoning local plant and animal life as well as area residents. The murder of an environmental protection agency investigator leads officials to assign Jack Taggart (Steven Segal) to go undercover as a handyman working through a relief mission. It doesn't take him long to discover that the mastermind of the dumping is local businessman Orin Hanner (Kris Kristofferson). Along the way, Taggart falls for the mysterious Sarah Kellogg (Marg Helgenberger), a young woman ostracized for a sordid past and a father who died under suspicious circumstances while working for Hanner. When Taggart's undercover work proves ineffective, he provokes a direct confrontation with the villain and his henchmen that results in plenty of Segal's trademark martial arts action. In addition to kicking the stuffing out of bad guys, Segal demonstrates a real knack for playing bluegrass guitar(n)

programme.title: Enter the Dragon
programme.desc: A martial arts master uses a tournament to infiltrate the island fortress of a one-armed drug baron. Action(n)

Now, a year later, an unsuspecting young couple, George and Kathy Lutz, and their children move into the house that was the site of the horrific event and is now haunted by a murderous presence. What follows is 28 days of unimaginable terror. With demonic visions of the dead and relentless screams of terror, this is the haunted house story that isn't just a movie - it's real(n)

programme.title: Run Fatboy Run

Swiftly paced and exuberantly acted, the rom-com costars Hank Azaria as Newton's new beau, a devoted American hedge-fund manager who run marathons. Pegg co-wrote the script with Michael Ian Black. programme.title: The Housing Enforcers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright meets a couple in Wiltshire who are struggling to remain independent in their own home, while in Suffolk, officers tackle a tenant's anti-social behaviour.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts, along with former footballer Dion Dublin, explore properties in Birmingham, Oldham in Greater Manchester and Gravesend in Kent. They then speak to the new owners about how much they paid for them at auction, and discuss their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Officers search for a Hungarian man convicted of burglaries in West Yorkshire, while a drugs courier is arrested by Dutch police after more than a decade on the run.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright and the team reveal the travel operators using counterfeit Atol memberships to convince travellers to book with them and part with thousands of pounds. Plus, the LED lights that are a safety hazard, and the story of a boy who died after eating fake almond powder in a curry.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The cathedral city of Peterborough hosts guest presenter Anita Manning and experts Philip Serrell and Mark Stacey, who guide the Star Wars fanatic, shoe collector and two very close friends that make up the red and blue teams.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Valerie receives a frosty warning from Mrs Tembe, things become heated between Daniel and Zara during their camping trip and Al meets a patient with a heart condition.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: A couple from Glasgow take part in the quiz, answering questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. Hosted by Matt Allwright.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson searches for properties in Cheshire for a couple who are seeking a new rural life, and along the way he visits the Anderton Boat lift built in the Victorian era.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades salvages three items bound for the skip in Walsall, featuring a Lloyd Loom-style laundry basket, a reclining chair and an oak writing bureau.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: The experts visit Althorp House, Herstmonceux Castle, Reading Town Hall and Greenwich Royal Naval College to value collectables and antiques being sold at auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker hosts the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The sheriffs try to recover owed money from a limousine company, but the boss is not keen on meeting with them. Elsewhere, sheriff Ken Warby goes to a dress shop to get money back for a client who was left more than £1,000 out of pocket when her order went badly wrong, but even with the help of a High Court Writ, Ken finds himself in the most difficult confrontation of his career. Plus, the enforcers come to the aid of a luxury motorhome owner, who was left high and dry when a customer cancelled a crucial booking at short notice.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Bidford-on-Avon.
programme.desc: The team help transform the home in Bidford-on-Avon of a woman suffering from mastocytosis, a rare genetic disorder, who has been forced to stay in the living room of her family's house under constant care since her diagnosis at the age of 18. Nick Knowles, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and hundreds of Warwickshire volunteer builders redesign the entire house to provide Chloe with independence, creating a self-contained apartment complete with bedroom, wet room and sitting room within her family home.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: John has had a fancy new hands-free phone kit fitted in his car, but he arrives at Kayleigh's house only to discover she is far more excited by the previous night's events. Comedy about the daily journeys of supermarket employees John Redmond and Kayleigh Kitson, who have been thrown together in a company car share scheme, with each trip bringing fresh insight into their lives, as well as twists and turns in their unlikely relationship. Co-written by and starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson, with Simon Greenall.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: English cricketer Paul Collingwood, Olympic gymnast Amy Tinkler, Paralympic table tennis star Will Bayley, and former Republic of Ireland international footballer Clinton Morrison join team captains Phil Tufnell and Matt Dawson and host Sue Barker on the light-hearted quiz.(n)

programme.title: The Big Painting Challenge
programme.desc: Mariella Frostrup and Rev Richard Coles present the final from Greenwich. At Queen's House, the artists are challenged to paint a portrait, but are not told who the subject is until the sitting begins. For the last test of the series, the painters must depict the Old Royal Naval College as seen from the Thames - and mentors Diana Ali and Pascal Anson are not on hand to help this time. Judges Lachlan Goudie, Daphne Todd and David Dibosa assess their efforts and reveal who is this series' champion.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: The Housing Enforcers
programme.desc: Residents in Newcastle who have become prisoners in their own homes, thanks to a neighbour's terrifying behaviour. Plus, north London tenants isolated from their community.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A lot including a fish-and-chip shop, a flat and a storage area in Fareham, Hampshire, plus a semi in Dudley in the West Midlands, and a studio flat in Croydon, south east London.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: A dawn raid in London leads to the arrest of an elusive Portuguese woman wanted for embezzlement. West Yorkshire police track a teenager's attacker all the way to Slovakia.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates bike helmets for sale that fail safety tests, as well as counterfeit pesticides that could be heading for UK farms, and the problem of fake supermarket savings stamps.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts help two teams search for bargains at Staffordshire County Showground. Paul Laidlaw assists a mother-and-daughter pair with expensive tastes, while Mark Stacey joins two cheeky police officers. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott spends some time bouncing around on a vintage exercise device.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Jimmi returns from his trip to a harsh reality check, while Daniel accuses Zara of foul play. Karen finds herself in a dangerous situation after misjudging someone's behaviour.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz, in which three friends from Bidford-on-Avon must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple from London find a new home in the Cornish countryside. They have a budget of £500,000 to spend on a property, and would like it to have holiday let potential. Meanwhile, away from the search, Alistair gets a taste of the sea.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades saves a battered suitcase, a wingback chair and a Formica table top from the recycling centre, and tries to transform them with the help of Daniel Heath and Ray Clarke.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Anita Manning and David Harper are in Reading, Berkshire, where items including a biscuit barrel shaped like a Scottish curling stone and a silver box with a Jasper stone top.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Angela Scanlon present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Preston convinces Michelle to leave Dennis home alone so they can have a romantic evening. But it's clear the pressure is getting to her. Whitney tries to get to the bottom of what's going on with Lauren, and as things grow fraught between the pair, a few home truths are laid bare. Denise's meeting gets off to a bad start although one of the suggestions to help the community seems like a good idea.(n)

programme.title: Shop Well for Less
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Steph McGovern are in Surrey, where a year ago part-time teacher Flo took some time out to look after the couple's children, aged four, five and six - but her love of socialising means she regularly goes into her overdraft. Meanwhile, her petrolhead husband John has an expensive hobby, buying various spare parts and paying for a second garage. How will the couple feel when some of their favourite products are taken away? Plus, a group of campers test different canopies and Avi Shankar reveals how early children can be influenced by advertising.(n)

programme.title: The Red Nose African Convoy
programme.desc: Six celebrities set out on a 700km drive across East Africa to deliver crucial supplies that will help Comic Relief projects continue their life-saving health work. Working in pairs, David Baddiel, Hugh Dennis, Reggie Yates, Michaela Coel, Katy Brand and Russell Kane put their driving skills to the test as they brave the infamous Northern Corridor, considered to be one of the world's most dangerous roads to lead a convoy delivering vital supplies across East Africa. Along the way they visit a maternity unit where supplies are scarce, find out about projects to help those with HIV, deliver bicycles to health workers and distribute 3,000 life-saving mosquito nets.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Bangor, north Wales, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from the audience.(n)

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil introduces a round-table chat, in which he, Michael Portillo and other guests take a light-hearted romp through the latest political and parliamentary developments.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents examples of memento mori jewellery, which were created in Victorian times to commemorate the dead, that have appeared on the show. Plus, advice on how to read hallmarks.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: In Spain, Inspector Olga Lizana from the Spanish National Police's Extradition team searches for Andrew Moran, who has been on the run for seven years.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: At Witley Recycling Centre in Surrey, Sarah Moore rescues colourful suede hides, a vintage radio and a set of microphone stands for transforming into potentially lucrative items.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: The food writer and former Great British Bake Off judge celebrates the everyday food and ingredients she has always loved, from hearty and wholesome ideas to dishes that are a little bit more indulgent. Mary begins by travelling to Scotland to enjoy the best of the country's staple foods, preparing recipes inspired by her own Scots heritage. She discovers wonderful shellfish in Ullapool, joins chef Tom Kitchin to share the joy of venison cooked on a barbecue and whips up her special whisky cream on the banks of a loch.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the final leg of his journey following the route of the North Country Continental service. Along the way he meets volunteers on the Mid-Suffolk Light railway and is permitted to drive `The Middy'. In Leiston, Michael uncovers the world's first purpose-built assembly line, while in Ipswich the work of a young Victorian engineering prodigy impresses the ex-politician. At his destination of Harwich the presenter discovers how the port became a gateway to the continent, only to be superseded by a new deep-water port further inland.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Including coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the House of Commons at 12.00. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: An appeal on behalf of the Cure Parkinson's Trust, the UK's only registered charity dedicated to finding a cure for Parkinson's disease, and founded by people with the condition.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The presenters seek out the ideal locations to enjoy their personal passions. Nick Crane heads to the Inner Hebrides to attempt a mountaineering challenge on the Isle of Skye, and reveals how Thomas Cook was inspired in the mid-19th century to create his famous package tours by the steamships criss-crossing Scottish waters. Avid knitter Ruth Goodman gets some tips for completing a complex fisherman's jumper by visiting Polperro in Cornwall, learning how people's livelihoods 150 years ago depended on their skills at making workwear to order. Poet Ian McMillan looks for creative ideas in the Cornish seaside resort of St Ives and explores the life and work of self-taught artist Alfred Wallis, and Tessa Dunlop explores the glamorous history of British lidos - public outdoor swimming pools that sprang up around the UK in the 1930s.(n)

programme.title: Beat the Brain
programme.desc: A police detective, an auctioneer, a customer services officer and a social club manager face puzzles, problems, posers and conundrums designed to test every part of their mental fitness against the show's resident genius - The Brain - in the hope of winning a jackpot of £3,000. Hosted by John Craven, with Josie Lawrence as The Brain.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Gok Wan joins Brian Conley to revisit some classic television series of his formative years. From the magic and mystery of Japanese children's drama Monkey, to the pan-European quiz show Going for Gold, via groundbreaking, anarchic pop series The Tube, these were the shows that apparently helped shape Gok into the style icon that he is today.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Actor Patrick Stewart's memories of his childhood are scarred by recollections of domestic abuse. In this documentary tracing his ancestry, he investigates his father's extraordinary career in the Army and discovers the shocking impact it had on his character. Patrick recalls that his mother was subjected to outbursts of violence by her husband, and that an ambulance occasionally had to be called. In later life, the star has used his fame to try to help people in similar circumstances.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: A critically ill miniature donkey foal makes an emotional emergency case for equine vet Kerry, and Richard creates an operating table from a forklift truck. At the Small Animal Hospital, senior vet Adam's job is anything but routine when he X-rays a tortoise and treats a gecko with a problem eye. Narrated by Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The naturalist examines what the next few decades may hold for this remarkable ecosystem, and looks at the work of scientists who are trying to preserve the area and the species that inhabit it, assisted by research vessel the Alucia. He also embarks on an ambitious attempt to dive further into the reef than ever before to witness the resilient coral that live down in the depths and see if they hold answers that may help to overcome challenges that lie ahead, as the impact of humans on the reef continues to take its toll. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott presents as two teams search for antiques in Leominster, Herefordshire, led by experts Charles Hanson and Jonathan Pratt. Tim also examines two wooden items, while tension rises at the auction.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Comfort Food
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers update old favourite the Rum Baba, and make the most of a great cut of beef when they create a traditional Greek Stifado.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his trusty 1913 Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo ventures east through Romania to the shores of the Black Sea. Along the way he encounters a bloodsucking vampire in Transylvania and brown bears in the Carpathian forest, before visiting a fairytale castle with modern conveniences in Sinaia, striking oil in Ploiesti, tapping into the nation's musical soul in Bucharest and loading cargo from a crane in Constanta. This leg of his journey ends at Constanta, where Michael explores what is now emerging as Europe's largest grain port.(n)

programme.title: The House That £100K Built
programme.desc: Kevin and Lesley have lived on the Isle of Sheppey for over a decade and have longed for the perfect home in their dream location, and have decided to design an eye-catching house that echoes the nearby seaside. Elsewhere, farmers Sue and Tim complete the interior work in their ambitious cantilevered home, which has been an on-going project for around nine years.(n)

programme.title: Incredible Medicine: Dr Weston's Casebook
programme.desc: Gabriel Weston continues to unlock the secrets of the human body, investigating some of the most extraordinary cases in medicine. First, she hears the story of a man with bones much stronger than the norm, and a girl whose arm will not stop growing. Dr Weston also learns of a woman who became pregnant with twins, but in two separate wombs, and a woman with a condition that means she is able to get lost within her own home.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Direct from the stage at London's Hammersmith Apollo, Channel 4's Chatty Man host Alan Carr is joined by comedy circuit stars Francesca Martinez and Nish Kumar for another celebration of stand-up comedy.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Cameras follow prosecutors and cops in Jacksonville, Florida, renowned for its tough approach to justice. In the first edition, detectives are called to the scene of a double homicide in a trailer park, where an uncle and niece have been found strangled in their home. In the courts, Trey Wright is being prosecuted for the murder of his cousin, while controversial state attorney Angela Corey is campaigning for re-election.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets of Your Food
programme.desc: Michael Mosley and James Wong reveal the physics, chemistry and biology hidden inside various foods. In the opening episode they explore how this chemistry fuels and builds bodies, with Michael sampling most people's first meal - human breast milk, which contains important fats, carbohydrates, vitamins and minerals. Michael and James also unravel why sourdough bread is so beneficial, how the rice has become a comforting staple food, and why allowing mushrooms to `sunbathe' may help provide a welcome calcium boost.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Events take a very unexpected turn when Lawrence and Kev visit a business selling mobility scooters that owes a customer a refund, while Ken is confronted with a very unusual problem as he tries to enforce a High Court writ at a jeweller. A woman was left on the brink of financial ruin after a building project went wrong, so Tommy and Craig track down the man who the courts say owes her money - but will he pay up?.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team take a look at the finer things in life as they go behind the scenes at Longleat House in Wiltshire.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Officers search for a Hungarian man convicted of burglaries in West Yorkshire, while a drugs courier is arrested by Dutch police after more than a decade on the run.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades salvages three items bound for the skip in Walsall, featuring a Lloyd Loom-style laundry basket, a reclining chair and an oak writing bureau.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don kicks off the gardening year from Longmeadow, sharing his tips for pruning, planting up pots for spring colour and sharing his plans for the coming year. At the National Trust's Packwood House in Warwickshire, the herbaceous borders come under Adam Frost's scrutiny as he finds out how they have been planted for maximum colour and impact. Over the course of this 50th series, Carol Klein will be sharing some of her heroes of gardening. She begins with plantswoman, garden designer and author Beth Chatto.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland.
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins a journey across Ireland, starting in the port of Wexford, where he takes to the seas in a 100-year-old lifeboat and discovers a hero of the American navy.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman hosts the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Building Dream Homes
programme.desc: As Bobby Halliday's development in Stirlingshire nears completion, one client's obsession with cars forces a complete redesign of the house he is moving into. Near Edinburgh, architects Christopher Dinnis and Carolyn Whiteford work with a family to gain planning permission to convert an old silversmith's in the heart of a conservation village into a family home.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Brian Conley invites Pam Ayres to pick the TV shows that shaped her life, with the poet's selection including one of the scariest series ever broadcast on British TV.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Singer Annie Lennox researches the female ancestry of her family. As the Eurythmics star and campaigner visits Aberdeen, where she was born, the coastal town of Banff and a Highland estate, she uncovers dark tales of tangled relationships, illegitimacy and poverty, and discovers the humiliations her unmarried great-great-grandmother suffered before the Kirk.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Small-animal vet Adam decides that his Shetland pony Hector should have an operation to make him less aggressive, and Steve helps a border collie with a womb infection. Meanwhile in Teesdale, farm vet Graham discovers a cow is having difficulty giving birth to twins.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough and the Giant Egg
programme.desc: David Attenborough returns to Madagascar to see how the island has changed in the 50 years since his first visit, and to search for more clues about one of his most treasured possessions, the egg of an elephant bird, an ostrich-like creature that weighed half a ton. Scientists perform tests to determine the age of the egg, as the naturalist discovers whether the bird's extinction can shed light on what is happening on the island today.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Richard Madley head to Peterborough where they help two teams, which include a community cook and a playground equipment, designer search for bargains. Paul Laidlaw guest presents.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Comfort Food
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers prove that home-made can beat shop-bought when they prepare gravlax, jam doughnuts and their own corned beef.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels from the Swiss Alps to the shores of Lake Geneva. Along the way, he is caught up in a war zone with the Red Cross and rescued from an `avalanche' by a St Bernard puppy. He takes to the skies in a vintage bi-plane to retrace the epic journey of the pioneering pilot who was first to fly over the Alps, and tries his hand at watchmaking, James Bond style.(n)

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: Sara Cox presents the final, in which the last three potters have to make a pair of identical, fully functioning light features from porcelain, the delicate clay that is the trickiest to work with. But that's not all. In the spot test, they are challenged to sculpt the torso of a special guest, ice dancer Sylvian Longchambon, and in the throw down they must make as many Japanese lanterns as they can in 10 minutes. But as this is the final, they have to do it the authentic Japanese way, with the wheel turning clockwise - the opposite of what they are used to. After all their hard work, who will be judged the winner? Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Last Kingdom
programme.desc: Spies infiltrate the Cumbraland army, leaving Uhtred to rely on his troops to protect him from a perilous attack. While he rides out as the dead horseman once again, Kjartan's thirst for revenge grows ever stronger. Hild goes on a journey of self-discovery as she considers exchanging her life as a nun for that of a warrior, and Guthred's efforts to emulate Alfred's peace-making tactics backfires when his indecision and lack of ruthlessness weakens the Saxons' position. Meanwhile, when Uhtred's attraction for Gisela reaches new heights, his enemies close in and he suffers a grave betrayal.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Rob Beckett, Gary Delaney, Elis James and Sara Pascoe join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the comedy show, looking back at events from September 2016 through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Rory Reid and Sabine Schmitz go in search of the latest supercars at Germany's Nurburgring circuit, while Matt LeBlanc test drives the Aston Martin DB11, but finds Chris Harris and his Mercedes causing no end of trouble. Tamsin Greig takes to the Top Gear Test Track as this week's Star in a Reasonably Fast Car.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great Irish Journeys with Martha Kearney
programme.desc: The broadcaster follows in the footsteps of 19th-century artist George Victor Du Noyer, who spent 35 years charting the landscape, people and buildings of Ireland. In the first episode, Martha gives an introduction to Du Noyer's work, and travels to the Bog of Allen, which lies between the Liffey and Shannon, and the Old Head of Kinsale in Co Cork.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Volcano
programme.desc: The team pushes deeper into the rainforest on the tropical island of New Guinea, where cameraman Gordon Buchanan enlists the aid of local tribespeople to help him film birds of paradise performing their unusual courtship ritual. George McGavin has to contend with a giant crocodile, and Steve Backshall discovers a hidden network of caves never previously seen by humans.(n)

programme.title: Billy Elliot
programme.desc: A northern youngster is pushed into taking boxing lessons by his macho dad - but secretly enrolls in a ballet class instead, where it soon becomes clear he has a real talent for fancy footwork. However, he faces a tough time convincing his father that dance is a worthwhile pursuit. Comedy drama, starring Jamie Bell, Julie Walters and Gary Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits archaeological digs in the north of Britain, where finds include evidence for the first Roman siege in the UK. There's also a look at Lindisfarne, which was violently sacked by the Vikings 1,000 years ago.(n)

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The series concludes with a visit to the country's eastern seaboard to investigate how the Chinese government is managing environmental concerns while meeting the ever-expanding needs of the population. Among the region's diverse locales lie futuristic cities, seaweed-thatched villages and rugged wetlands that are home to some of the world's rarest animal species. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Art of Gothic: Britain's Midnight Hour
programme.desc: Andrew Graham-Dixon examines England's Gothic Revival - an architectural movement that began in the mid-1700s. He starts by exploring its restrained aristocratic beginnings, then reveals how it went on to influence some of Britain's most famous artwork and buildings.(n)

programme.title: Britain in Focus: A Photographic History
programme.desc: Eamonn McCabe traces the story of British photography from the explosion of colour images in the late-1950s to the ongoing impact of the digital revolution.(n)

programme.title: Good Swan, Bad Swan: Dancing Swan Lake
programme.desc: Ballerina and Artistic Director of English National Ballet Tamara Rojo takes viewers backstage as she prepares for her challenging dual role in Swan Lake as contrasting characters Odette and Odile. Tamara discusses the physical and psychological demands of the job, and also reveals some of her inspirations as she looks back at the ballet's history.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen present music from June 8, featuring Twisted Sister, the Imposter - aka Elvis Costello - Shakatak, Big Country and the Police.(n)

programme.title: Henry VIII: Patron or Plunderer
programme.desc: Part one of two. Historian Jonathan Foyle examines the often contradictory character of the Tudor monarch. Henry ordered the killing of writers and the demolition of ancient monasteries during his reign, yet was a cultured man who brought the Renaissance to England with a major building programme, tapestry collection and genuine love of the arts.(n)

programme.title: The Golden Age of Steam Railways
programme.desc: Part one of two. The story of the visionaries who rescued some of the narrow gauge railways that once served Britain's key industries, including its mines, quarries, factories and docks. Home movies reveal how volunteers set to work to bring the lines and steam engines back to life after they disappeared in the years following the Second World War. Narrated by Jenny Agutter.(n)

programme.title: Meet the Lords
programme.desc: Documentary filmed over a year following life at the House of Lords, one of Britain's oldest, most idiosyncratic and most important institutions, going behind the scenes during a turbulent 12 months that has seen dramatic changes in the political landscape and the Lords battling it out with the Government. The first edition introduces the larger-than-life characters that populate the House, including new people's peers, hereditaries and political grandees, as they try to change legislation and follow their personal passions.(n)

programme.title: Tales from the Royal Bedchamber
programme.desc: Historian Lucy Worsley examines the changing fortunes of the British monarchy by touring a selection of bedrooms once occupied by members of the royal family. Along the way, she reveals the extent of the nation's age-old obsession with royal babies, weddings and successions.(n)

programme.desc: The team's mission to track the arsonist targeting US Navy facilities appears to end in success when the man in question is killed by a thermite explosion on board the USS Brewer. programme.desc: Episode 618.
