programme.desc: A chance encounter leads to an invitation for Jean to stay at her sister-in-law's home, but she has to persuade Lionel to accompany her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon is disgusted to see the staff compete fiercely for the coveted title of employee of the month and a trip for two to Paris. Colin's attempts to impress his boss with a spectacular magic act end in disaster.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: When Gavin goes missing on a staff weekend, everyone assumes the worst. Brittas even sets the wheels in motion to arrange his subordinate's funeral. Chris Barrie stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo speculates why blood rushes to the head when upside down but not to the feet while standing up, so Seymour sets up an experiment to demonstrate the way the body works. Comedy, starring Bill Owen and Michael Aldridge.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo pulls a piece of antique silver from the canal, and Seymour sets about recovering any other items down there, with the intention of returning them to their rightful owners.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: An afternoon driving around in Wesley's car proves to be tough on the feet. Compo is suffering from hard skin and places his faith in a herbal jelly from a gypsy healer. Bill Owen stars.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: The friends gather for Joyce's retirement party, where John has made a tribute video - but forgotten to ask Trevor for his contribution - and Maureen latches onto a trendy young couple. Alan also has bad news that might ruin proceedings - unless the guest of honour spoils it first by confronting her neighbour about her kids' unruly behaviour. Alison Steadman and Philip Jackson star in the sitcom, with Russ Abbot, Stephanie Beacham, Paula Wilcox and James Smith.(n)

programme.title: Porridge: Inside Out
programme.desc: Series examining the making of the ever-popular prison sitcom, featuring contributions from cast members, writers and fans.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes is disappointed to discover she is not invited to Maria's hen party because of her age, and decides to gatecrash the event, only to end up at the wrong venue. She then tries to impress the bride-to-be's mother during a dinner date, but is so nervous she turns to drink, and the evening descends into chaos. Comedy, written by and starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Harry Enfield and Chums
programme.desc: Comedy sketches with the funnyman and partners in mirth Paul Whitehouse and Kathy Burke. Featuring characters including Kevin and Perry, Tim Nice-But-Dim and the Self Righteous Brothers.(n)

programme.title: The Trip
programme.sub-title: The Trip to Italy: Il Cenobio dei Dogi, Camogli.
programme.desc: Sequel to improvised comedy The Trip, with Steve Coogan and Rob Brydon once again playing versions of themselves. The two comedy actors are asked to embark on another round of restaurant reviews for a Sunday newspaper, this time in Italy. Steve is on hiatus from his American TV series and isn't drinking while Rob is looking to unwind with his time away from his young family. They begin their trip in Piedmont at the Trattoria Della Posta before stopping at the poet Byron's former house in Genoa on their way to the Cenobio dei Dogi in Camogli. Michael Winterbottom directs.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark feels the need to impress Dobby and gets a lucky break when his book Business Secrets of the Pharaohs is accepted by a publisher. Jeremy enrols on a life-coaching course, but things become complicated when he sleeps with his tutor. Comedy, starring David Mitchell and Robert Webb.(n)

programme.desc: Tom prepares a macabre wedding cake for a goth bride, while Beth prepares a cake celebrating the 30th anniversary of rock band Alien Sex Fiend.(n)

programme.title: The Great Comic Relief Bake Off
programme.desc: Jo Brand hosts the third edition, in which four celebrities take on three baking challenges - and maybe even make some dough for Comic Relief. Movie star Michael Sheen, comedian and writer David Mitchell, Radio 1 DJ Jameela Jamil and campaigner for global education and health issues Sarah Brown are the hopefuls, tackling 24 portions of shortbread, six mini pork pies in the technical round and a showstopper consisting of a triple-tiered pavlova with fruit. Judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood taste the results and decide who should be crowned Star Baker.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Eight more contenders enter the kitchen, where Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace challenge them to make a dish of their own invention using a selection of seven ingredients - including crab meat, sea purslane, mango, ricotta and coconut. They each have just one hour to hold their nerve and demonstrate their creativity to the judges.(n)

programme.title: Destination Flavour Down Under
programme.desc: Adam Liaw takes viewers on a culinary journey to Australia, offering an insight into the country's food and culture, as well as the people he meets along the way.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore how Britain's love of cheese has evolved over centuries, travelling to Scotland to sample some of its finest varieties and discovering that the original cheesecake recipes were not American but British.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall prepares dishes using seasonal lettuce and spinach from his kitchen garden, and dandelion and burdock grown in the hedgerows. The experimental Bristol smallholding receives four saddleback pigs, and vegetarian Susan accepts the task of butchering a whole lamb's carcass. Plus, the chef's country honey is pitted against the city variety at a taste-off in Broadway market.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits the town of Madurai in Tamil Nadu, where he learns the art of temple cooking and samples south Indian dish sambar. He then takes a road trip across the Western Ghats to the state of Kerala, where he prepares regional dessert payasam and a traditional pork curry.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The first two semi-finalists are challenged to work a shift at Marcus Wareing's Michelin-starred restaurant at the Berkeley hotel in central London. The pair must prepare a dish featuring roast lobster, smoked egg yolk and broccoli cooked four ways and dress it in two sauces - all under the watchful eye of Marcus. They then face a final test in which they must use what they have learned from their experience to cook a main course and a dessert - but only one can go through to the last round of the contest.(n)

programme.title: The Great Comic Relief Bake Off
programme.desc: Ed Byrne hosts the final edition, joined by four more well-known faces hoping to inspire people to get baking for Comic Relief. Comedian and actress Victoria Wood, former Radio 1 DJ Chris Moyles, model and TV presenter Alexa Chung and Asylum star Kayvan Novak are the hopefuls, who will be tackling a traybake, rustling up a dozen crumpets and getting creative with a vegetable cake that must also double as a self portrait. Judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood taste the results and decide who will be crowned Star Baker.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four of the eight chefs from the previous heat return to face a skills test in which they must each create a savoury sabayon sauce and use it to make a glaze for seafood. Michel Roux Jr then challenges them to prepare French pork pie stuffed with chestnuts and apple and served with a British salad cream, before the contenders prepare their own choice of dish to be judged by Michel and Monica Galetti, who pick three to advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: In the final instalment of their culinary journey through the history of British cuisine, Si King and Dave Myers explore comfort food, discussing how certain ingredients and recipes can give people a sense of well-being, such as chicken noodle soup and a simple fish dish.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: The potatoes and radishes are ready for picking and the broad beans are de-podded for a luxurious dish of beans on toast. Jess chooses a batch of hens from a battery egg farm as the Bristol experiment to turn an acre of derelict city land into a smallholding continues. Back at River Cottage, Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall organises a foraging competition and finds his ducklings hatch days early.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef goes in search of the best chicken korma in Lucknow, learns the complexities of making rice dish pulao and joins thousands of partygoers at one of India's major Hindu festivals. Further north in Punjab, he observes the age-old process involved in the production of the unrefined sugar known as jaggery and is recruited as a guest judge to find the state's new `Star Chef'. Rick also demonstrates how to make nimish, a dessert with hints of saffron, pistachios and cardamom, as well as vegetarian curry paneer jalfrezi.(n)

programme.title: People Just Do Nothing

programme.title: American Psycho

programme.title: Homeless: The Motel Kids of Orange County
programme.desc: A chronicle of homeless kids in California who live in motels with their families while attending school year-round. Produced and directed by Alexandra Pelosi(n)

programme.title: Blues Brothers 2000
programme.desc: Upon his release from prison, now-brotherless Blues Brother Jake Elwood puts the band back together with the help of a golden-voiced strip joint bartender and a precocious 10-year-old orphan on loan from the comically abusive Sister Mary Stigmata. This hysterical sequel to the original Blues Brothers comedy/musical makes good use of its copious celebrity cameos, which include appearances from old schoolers James Brown, Aretha Franklin, Eric Clapton, Bo Diddley, and Isaac Hayes(n)

programme.title: Everything Is Copy - Nora Ephron: Scripted & Unscripted
programme.desc: Profiling multitalented writer Nora Ephron. Friends and family discuss the late Ephron's keen wit, her remarkable body of work—which includes everything from newspaper columns to classic films—and her private battle with leukemia(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: Collision Course
programme.desc: Bumbling saber-toothed squirrel Scrat continues to cause mischief in outer space, where he sets off a series of events that send an asteroid hurtling toward Earth. Soon, Manny the woolly mammoth (voiced by Ray Romano), Sid the sloth (John Leguizamo), and Diego the saber-toothed tiger (Denis Leary) embark on a journey with their rambunctious animal friends to prevent the asteroid from ending life as they know it. Simon Pegg, Queen Latifah, Adam DeVine, Nick Offerman, and Jennifer Lopez also lend their voices to this animated sequel(n)

programme.title: The Glass House
programme.desc: Taut direction and strong performances recommend this first-rate suspense yarn. When their parents are killed, two orphans (Trevor Morgan, Leelee Sobieski) move in with a wealthy and seemingly benevolent couple (Stellan Skarsgard, Diane Lane). But soon the adoptive parents begin to behave in a sinister manner, making the kids' lives a nightmare. Bruce Dern, Kathy Baker(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: In Washington, D.C., in the year 2054, murder has been eliminated. The future is seen and the guilty punished before the crime has ever been committed. From a nexus deep within the Justice Department's elite Precrime Unit, all the evidence to convict - from imagery alluding to the time, place and other details - is seen by Pre-Cogs, three psychic beings whose visions of murder have never been wrong. It is the nation's most advanced crime force, a perfect system. And no-one works harder for Precrime than its top man, Chief John Anderton. Destroyed by a tragic loss, Anderton has thrown all of his passion into a system that could potentially spare thousands of people from the tragedy he lived through. Six years later, the coming vote to take it national has only fuelled his conviction that Precrime works. Anderton has no reason to doubt it... until he becomes its #1 suspect(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: The X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse (Oscar Isaac) in this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s. Eager to take over the world and remake it in his own image, Apocalypse recruits mutants to act as his powerful "Four Horsemen" -- among them is the tortured Magneto (Michael Fassbender), who believes humanity might be a lost cause after a personal tragedy. In time, Charles Xavier (James McAvoy) and his charges must work together to save the planet from this threat. New additions to this X-Men team include the elusive Nightcrawler (Kodi Smit-McPhee), fiery Cyclops (Tye Sheridan), and telepathically gifted Jean Grey (Sophie Turner). Rose Byrne, Jennifer Lawrence, and Olivia Munn co-star(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: After discovering the truth about their walled city and breaking down its faction system, Tris and Four lead a journey out of Chicago to learn more about who has been manipulating their civilization in this thrilling entry in the YA adventure series. But once their group comes face-to-face with the society that turned their city into an enclosed experiment, secrets are uncovered that threaten the fate of humankind(n)

The film stars Jesse Eisenberg, Mark Ruffalo and Woody Harrelson, and is directed by Jon M. Chu(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies

Meanwhile, Principal Nippal and Ms Barnes discuss the Ziggy-Amabella situation with Jane; and Celeste has a solo session with Dr Reisman, who presses her for more details on her marriage(n)

programme.title: Girls

Meanwhile, Hannah turns down Adam's request to screen his film, but gets important advice from her dad and his new partner, Keith; and Elijah catches the acting bug again after helping a coworker with an audition(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: The X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse (Oscar Isaac) in this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s. In time, Charles Xavier (James McAvoy) and his charges must work together to save the planet from this threat. programme.title: Animals.
programme.desc: Rats. In the Season 2 premiere, two rats enter a love triangle with an imaginary friend when they get stuck in an animal testing lab. Meanwhile, two fleas discuss their basketball dreams on a monkey's back; and algae question the meaning of life(n)

programme.title: UConn: The March to Madness
programme.desc: Episode 4. With their sights set on a fifth consecutive national title, the UConn Huskies begin play in the NCAA women's basketball championship tournament as the No. 1 seed in the Bridgeport Regional(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Sheldon Whitehouse; Jake Tapper; Barney Frank; Andrew Sullivan
programme.desc: Sheldon Whitehouse; Jake Tapper; Barney Frank; Andrew Sullivan. Sen. Sheldon Whitehouse (D-R.I.) and CNN's Jake Tapper are the interview guests. The panelists are former representative Barney Frank and editor Andrew Sullivan(n)

programme.title: Bulletproof
programme.desc: Damon Wayans and Adam Sandler star in Bulletproof an action comedy from Universal Pictures. The story of a cop, a crook, and a beautiful friendship gone sour takes place in a world where loyalty goes to the highest bidder and the only one you can trust turns out to be your worst enemy. Once partners in crime, Archie Moses and Rock Keats are now on opposite sides of the law. Each feels betrayed by the other, but as fate would have it they're back together and on the run(n)

programme.title: Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius
programme.desc: The animated gadget inventor blasts off in his first feature film, a zippy animated adventure. When all the parents of Retroville are abducted by hungry aliens, it's up to Jimmy to go into outer space and save the day. Martin Short, Andrea Martin and Patrick Stewart lend their voices to this whiz-bang 'toon. Debi Derryberry(n)

programme.title: Joe Somebody
programme.desc: After being publicly humiliated by the office bully in front of his daughter on Bring Your Child to Work Day, a divorced office drone gives himself a makeover and starts training for a rematch. But as he unexpectedly begins climbing up the corporate ladder, he realises that he doesn't need revenge to earn his daughter's respect, or to become someone else to win the heart of his co-worker(n)

programme.title: Meet Dave
programme.desc: With their home planet in danger and no place in the known universe to seek shelter, a desperate crew of miniature alien humanoids boards a human spacecraft in hopes of saving their doomed world. Eddie Murphy stars in a sci-fi comedy that re-teams the longtime comic actor with Norbit director Brian Robbins(n)

programme.title: Heartbreakers
programme.desc: After the little white lies of Romy and Michele's High School Reunion (1997), director David Mirkin focuses on scheming of a different sort in Heartbreakers. Sigourney Weaver and Jennifer Love Hewitt play Max and Page Conners, a mother and daughter who share everything with each other: relationship advice, hair and makeup hints, and the money they win in costly divorce settlements with rich men. When the film opens, the Conners are putting the finishing touches on conning Dean (Ray Liotta), an auto-body shop owner. When the dust from that scam clears, Page announces she's ready to move away from her mother and set up shop on her own -- but in order to clear an outstanding debt, Max insists they bankrupt one more bachelor together. They settle upon phlegmatic Palm Springs widower William B. Tensy (Gene Hackman), a chain smoker with a heart of gold and a similarly bountiful bank account. Only two things stand in their way: Tensy's Teutonic caretaker Miss Madress (Nora Dunn) and beachfront bartender Jack (Jason Lee), a wry stargazer with whom Page becomes unexpectedly smitten. Heartbreakers is the third collaboration from writers Steven Mazur and Paul Guy, whose previous screwball comedy was 1997's international hit, Liar Liar(n)

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Eddie 'The Eagle' Edwards overcomes all odds and extraordinary challenges to become the first British man to compete in the Olympic ski jump event, making him the most famous ski jumper in the history of Great Britain(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: Set in South Carolina in 1964, this is the tale of Lily Owens a 14-year-old girl who is haunted by the memory of her late mother. To escape her lonely life and troubled relationship with her father, Lily flees with Rosaleen, her caregiver and only friend, to a South Carolina town that holds the secret to her mother's past. Taken in by the intelligent and independent Boatwright sisters, Lily finds solace in their mesmerizing world of beekeeping(n)

programme.title: The Music of Strangers: Yo-Yo Ma and the Silk Road Ensemble
programme.desc: This uplifting documentary profiles cellist Yo-Yo Ma and his Silk Road Ensemble, a collective of musicians who tour the world to perform and teach their craft(n)

programme.title: Rabbit Hole
programme.desc: In this intimate drama, Becca (Nicole Kidman) and her husband Howie (Aaron Eckhart) mourn the death of their son, who was hit by a car while chasing their dog into the street. The couple attend group therapy, where Howie befriends another woman. Meanwhile, Becca forms a tentative friendship with the teenager who accidentally killed her son. Directed by John Cameron Mitchell(n)

programme.title: X-Men: Apocalypse
programme.desc: The X-Men are forced to confront an ancient mutant called Apocalypse (Oscar Isaac) in this comic-book adventure set in the 1980s. Eager to take over the world and remake it in his own image, Apocalypse recruits mutants to act as his powerful "Four Horsemen" -- among them is the tortured Magneto (Michael Fassbender), who believes humanity might be a lost cause after a personal tragedy. In time, Charles Xavier (James McAvoy) and his charges must work together to save the planet from this threat. New additions to this X-Men team include the elusive Nightcrawler (Kodi Smit-McPhee), fiery Cyclops (Tye Sheridan), and telepathically gifted Jean Grey (Sophie Turner). Rose Byrne, Jennifer Lawrence, and Olivia Munn co-star(n)

programme.title: Animals.
programme.desc: Rats. In the Season 2 premiere, two rats enter a love triangle with an imaginary friend when they get stuck in an animal testing lab. Meanwhile, two fleas discuss their basketball dreams on a monkey's back; and algae question the meaning of life(n)

programme.title: UConn: The March to Madness
programme.desc: Episode 4. With their sights set on a fifth consecutive national title, the UConn Huskies begin play in the NCAA women's basketball championship tournament as the No. 1 seed in the Bridgeport Regional(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Sheldon Whitehouse; Jake Tapper; Barney Frank; Andrew Sullivan
programme.desc: Sheldon Whitehouse; Jake Tapper; Barney Frank; Andrew Sullivan. Sen. Sheldon Whitehouse (D-R.I.) and CNN's Jake Tapper are the interview guests. The panelists are former representative Barney Frank and editor Andrew Sullivan(n)

programme.title: Bulletproof
programme.desc: Damon Wayans and Adam Sandler star in Bulletproof an action comedy from Universal Pictures. The story of a cop, a crook, and a beautiful friendship gone sour takes place in a world where loyalty goes to the highest bidder and the only one you can trust turns out to be your worst enemy. Once partners in crime, Archie Moses and Rock Keats are now on opposite sides of the law. Each feels betrayed by the other, but as fate would have it they're back together and on the run(n)

programme.title: Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius
programme.desc: The animated gadget inventor blasts off in his first feature film, a zippy animated adventure. When all the parents of Retroville are abducted by hungry aliens, it's up to Jimmy to go into outer space and save the day. Martin Short, Andrea Martin and Patrick Stewart lend their voices to this whiz-bang 'toon. Debi Derryberry(n)

programme.title: Joe Somebody
programme.desc: After being publicly humiliated by the office bully in front of his daughter on Bring Your Child to Work Day, a divorced office drone gives himself a makeover and starts training for a rematch. But as he unexpectedly begins climbing up the corporate ladder, he realises that he doesn't need revenge to earn his daughter's respect, or to become someone else to win the heart of his co-worker(n)

programme.title: Meet Dave
programme.desc: With their home planet in danger and no place in the known universe to seek shelter, a desperate crew of miniature alien humanoids boards a human spacecraft in hopes of saving their doomed world. Eddie Murphy stars in a sci-fi comedy that re-teams the longtime comic actor with Norbit director Brian Robbins(n)

programme.title: Heartbreakers
programme.desc: After the little white lies of Romy and Michele's High School Reunion (1997), director David Mirkin focuses on scheming of a different sort in Heartbreakers. Sigourney Weaver and Jennifer Love Hewitt play Max and Page Conners, a mother and daughter who share everything with each other: relationship advice, hair and makeup hints, and the money they win in costly divorce settlements with rich men. When the film opens, the Conners are putting the finishing touches on conning Dean (Ray Liotta), an auto-body shop owner. When the dust from that scam clears, Page announces she's ready to move away from her mother and set up shop on her own -- but in order to clear an outstanding debt, Max insists they bankrupt one more bachelor together. They settle upon phlegmatic Palm Springs widower William B. Tensy (Gene Hackman), a chain smoker with a heart of gold and a similarly bountiful bank account. Only two things stand in their way: Tensy's Teutonic caretaker Miss Madress (Nora Dunn) and beachfront bartender Jack (Jason Lee), a wry stargazer with whom Page becomes unexpectedly smitten. Heartbreakers is the third collaboration from writers Steven Mazur and Paul Guy, whose previous screwball comedy was 1997's international hit, Liar Liar(n)

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Eddie 'The Eagle' Edwards overcomes all odds and extraordinary challenges to become the first British man to compete in the Olympic ski jump event, making him the most famous ski jumper in the history of Great Britain(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: Set in South Carolina in 1964, this is the tale of Lily Owens a 14-year-old girl who is haunted by the memory of her late mother. To escape her lonely life and troubled relationship with her father, Lily flees with Rosaleen, her caregiver and only friend, to a South Carolina town that holds the secret to her mother's past. Taken in by the intelligent and independent Boatwright sisters, Lily finds solace in their mesmerizing world of beekeeping(n)

programme.title: The Music of Strangers: Yo-Yo Ma and the Silk Road Ensemble
programme.desc: This uplifting documentary profiles cellist Yo-Yo Ma and his Silk Road Ensemble, a collective of musicians who tour the world to perform and teach their craft(n)

programme.title: Rabbit Hole
programme.desc: In this intimate drama, Becca (Nicole Kidman) and her husband Howie (Aaron Eckhart) mourn the death of their son, who was hit by a car while chasing their dog into the street. The couple attend group therapy, where Howie befriends another woman. Meanwhile, Becca forms a tentative friendship with the teenager who accidentally killed her son. Directed by John Cameron Mitchell(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 102. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
programme.desc: In this long-awaited reboot of the landmark series that helped define the postapocalyptic genre, loner Max (Tom Hardy) joins forces with the mysterious Imperator Furiosa (Charlize Theron) and a group of warrior women as they flee from an evil despot across a sun-parched wasteland(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: An exemplary biopic that focuses on the six years Capote spent working on his 1966 masterpiece "In Cold Blood"(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Danish Girl'
programme.desc: A look at "The Danish Girl," a 2015 adaptation of David Ebershoff's novel about early 20th-century Danish painter Einar Wegener, who was one of the first people to have sex-reassignment surgery. The film stars Eddie Redmayne, Alicia Vikander and Matthias Schoenaerts, and is directed by Tom Hooper(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Danish painter Einar Wegener begins living as a woman named Lili Elbe, and undergoes one of the world's first gender-reassignment surgeries in the 1930s. Lili struggles with her new identity as it strains her marriage to artist Gerda Wegener(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Conchords
programme.desc: Bret Gives Up the Dream. Murray tells the boys to get a job because the band has no money. But when Bret's sign-holding career gets in the way of the band, Murray fires him. Jemaine has to continue with a tape recorder. Features the songs Inner City Pressure and She's So Hot...Boom!(n)

programme.title: Class Divide
programme.desc: This documentary explores the gentrification of New York City via a single intersection in Chelsea, where children from both low-income public housing and an expensive private school interact. Directed by Marc Levin(n)

programme.title: Junior
programme.desc: Alex Hesse and Larry Arbogast are working on a new drug which will reduce the chances of a woman's body rejecting an embryo and thus causing a miscarriage. When their research funding is withdrawn, and human experimentation is denied to them, they decide to test the drug by breifly impregnating Hesse. Hesse however becomes attached to "his" unborn baby(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Bridget is emotionally satisfied at long last with Mark Darcy, her barrister boyfriend. But complicating issues is the re-entrance of her ex-lover, Daniel Cleaver, whom Jones, perhaps mistakenly, thought she had finally gotten over(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: Student Peter Parker develops superhuman strength after he's bitten by a laboratory spider. He starts to hit back against the school bullies, and then takes the fight against crime into the city. A huge hit: the eighth most successful film of all time(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: Wade Wilson, a former mercenary, is tricked into volunteering as the subject of a bizarre experiment that gives him superhuman abilities. He becomes an antihero with a warped sense of humour and goes on a mission to hunt down the people who are responsible for his twisted condition(n)

programme.title: Drumline
programme.desc: Energetic drama about a hotshot New York City percussionist who adjusts to the demands of a big-time college marching band while trying to fit in at the prestigious Atlanta university(n)

programme.title: Cop Car
programme.desc: Two rebellious young boys steal a police cruiser and go for a joyride. But when they find a dead body in the trunk, they realize they must evade the car's owner, a corrupt small-town sheriff who's desperate to reclaim his property(n)

programme.title: Balls of Fury
programme.desc: Dan Fogler has a ball in this fun satire. A former ping-pong phenom is recruited by an FBI agent (George Lopez) to infiltrate an international tournament being run by a diabolical criminal mastermind (played with devilish delight by Christopher Walken). The satire of sports and martial-arts films was directed by Robert Ben Garant, who co-wrote the script with Thomas Lennon, who costars as a German superstar player(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: The U.S. Federal Budget. The U.S. federal budget and proposed cuts by the Trump administration are discussed(n)

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Parents. Pete's folks come to New York for his mom's birthday, so he asks Jess to act like nothing's changed, but a tense dinner reveals harsh truths about their relationships as Jess struggles to keep quiet(n)

programme.title: UConn: The March to Madness
programme.desc: Episode 3. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Jerrod Carmichael: 8
programme.desc: Comedian Jerrod Carmichael performs in New York City at Masonic Hall. Topics include Donald Trump's victory; climate change; supporting the troops; animal rights; being a good boyfriend; and his top four fears(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: Wade Wilson, a former mercenary, is tricked into volunteering as the subject of a bizarre experiment that gives him superhuman abilities. He becomes an antihero with a warped sense of humour and goes on a mission to hunt down the people who are responsible for his twisted condition(n)

programme.title: Criminal
programme.desc: Sociopathic death-row inmate Jerico Stewart is implanted with the memories of a deceased CIA agent in a desperate attempt to thwart a deadly plot. At the same time, Jerico reconnects with his own humanity as he bonds with the late agent's family(n)

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Superman and Batman clash in this superhero movie(n)

programme.title: Quincy Jones: Burning the Light
programme.desc: Comedian Quincy Jones performs in Los Angeles at the Teragram Ballroom, and discusses his diagnosis of terminal cancer in July 2015. Other topics include same-sex marriage, finding true love and race(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: Director Richard LaGravenese's romantic drama stars Hilary Swank as Holly Kennedy, a New York real estate agent forced to come to terms with the unexpected death of her young husband Gerry. Before he died, Gerry wrote her a series of letters, to be delivered across the forthcoming year, hoping to help her grieve. The letters give her vivid flashbacks to their life together and, under his written direction, she visits Gerry's parents in Ireland, where she ultimately finds the strength to move on(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: Reteaming the director and star of Gangs of New York, Martin Scorcese's The Aviator stars Leonardo DiCaprio as legendary millionaire Howard Hughes. Focusing on the early part of Hughes' adult life, the film chronicles how he built his fortune, beginning as the proprietor of his late father's tool company, then as a Hollywood producer and the owner of RKO studios, and later as an aviation mogul. Alan Alda, Alec Baldwin, and Kate Beckinsale also star(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Zookeeper's Wife'
programme.desc: A look at "The Zookeeper's Wife," a 2017 drama based on Diane Ackerman's nonfiction book about a couple who used the Warsaw Zoo to save hundreds of Jews during the German occupation of Poland during World War II. The film stars Jessica Chastain, Johan Heldenbergh and Daniel Brühl, and is directed by Niki Caro(n)

programme.title: Mystic River
programme.desc: Three childhood friends whose lives are shattered when one of their daughters is brutally murdered, an event that forces them to confront a horrific episode from their own shared past(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: Segments include a report on former Maryland Terps basketball player Juan Dixon; a profile of 2004 top MLB draft pick Matt Bush; and an examination of the "yips," including a chat with former baseball player Rick Ankiel(n)

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Upon Jake's release from prison, the brothers are reunited and visit the orphanage they grew up in--only to discover that it is in danger of being shut down by the county for failure to pay taxes. With a little help from James Brown as a revival preacher, the Blues Brothers are divinely inspired to raise the $5,000 that the orphanage needs to stay open(n)

programme.title: UConn: The March to Madness
programme.desc: Episode 4. With their sights set on a fifth consecutive national title, the UConn Huskies begin play in the NCAA women's basketball championship tournament as the No. 1 seed in the Bridgeport Regional(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: The U.S. Federal Budget. The U.S. federal budget and proposed cuts by the Trump administration are discussed(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: The film revolves around virologist Robert Neville, who is immune to a man-made virus that was created to cure cancer but has now killed 90% of the human population. He lives in New York and is working on the cure for the virus while defending himself against mutants that have been created by the virus(n)

programme.title: Girls
programme.desc: Full Disclosure. Desi wants to bail on a gig that was planned for a birthday party for Marnie's mom in New Jersey. Meanwhile, Hannah turns down Adam's request to screen his film, but gets important advice from her dad and his new partner, Keith; and Elijah catches the acting bug again after helping a coworker with an audition(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.sub-title: Kings of Cannabis & Into the Darkness
programme.desc: Kings of Cannabis & Into the Darkness. New strains of marijuana are explored in a report from the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Also: a look at new studies of dark matter being conducted from an abandoned gold mine a mile beneath the Black Hills of South Dakota(n)

programme.desc: Rats. In the Season 2 premiere, two rats enter a love triangle with an imaginary friend when they get stuck in an animal testing lab. Meanwhile, two fleas discuss their basketball dreams on a monkey's back; and algae question the meaning of life(n)

programme.desc: Segments include a report on former Maryland Terps basketball player Juan Dixon; a profile of 2004 top MLB draft pick Matt Bush; and an examination of the "yips," including a chat with former baseball player Rick Ankiel(n)

programme.title: Any Given Sunday
programme.desc: 'On any given Sunday you're gonna win or you're gonna lose. The point is - can you win or lose like a man?' Macho stuff from director Oliver Stone, with a cast of heavyweights from both cinema and pro sport(n)

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Alien-hunting agents hunt extraterrestrials bent on destroying Earth in this sequel(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: Sick of being bullied by her overpowering Greek family, dowdy Toula signs up for college. Despite every warning, Toula falls for a non-Greek guy, but it's not easy getting her clan to accept him(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: Toula and Ian are parents to a teen daughter in this sequel that brings the entire Portokalos family together for another huge wedding(n)

programme.title: Tig Notaro: Boyish Girl Interrupted
programme.desc: Comedian Tig Notaro performs at the Wilbur Theatre in Boston. Topics include doing shows in Las Vegas; introducing her fiancée to her family in Mississippi; TSA screenings; small planes; Santa Claus; and misleading text messages. Taped May 31, 2015(n)

programme.title: License to Wed
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a newly engaged couple who must take an outlandish marriage-preparation course from a creepy clergyman(n)

programme.title: Repo Man
programme.desc: Harry Dean Stanton stars as a repossession man who inhabits the murky underworld of Los Angeles with Emilo Estevez as his apprentice. Alex Cox directs(n)

programme.title: Making of 'My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2'
programme.desc: A look at "My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2," a 2016 sequel to the 2002 hit that follows the Portokalos clan as they celebrate another momentous walk down the aisle. The film stars Nia Vardalos, John Corbett, Lainie Kazan and Michael Constantine, and is directed by Kirk Jones(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Tracy Turnblad dreams of TV stardom, and high school hunk Link Larkin. So when a detention encounter gives the wannabe teenybopper the dance moves she needs to make it onto the all-powerful Corny Collins Show, Tracy realises that her dreams could finally be coming true(n)

programme.title: Code Name: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Lame spy spoof with Cedric the Entertainer as an amnesiac who gets mixed up with secret agents and a high-level conspiracy(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: Eligible young people in New York City search for romance while living the single life with their friends(n)

programme.title: David Spade: Take the Hit
programme.desc: Former Saturday Night Live funnyman David Spade flies solo in an HBO stand-up special that originally aired on April 17, 1998 and finds the sarcastic, Scottsdale, Arizona native addressing a wide variety of topics ranging from everyday life to the rising prevalence of pop culture in mainstream media(n)

programme.title: Singles
programme.desc: Ensemble comedy and romance from six Seattle dwellers on the fringes of the city's music scene. Campbell Scott and Bridget Fonda lead a strong cast in a film directed by Cameron Crowe, the man behind Jerry Maguire(n)

programme.title: The Breakfast Club
programme.desc: Teen-angst comedy drama about five school kids - an athlete, a spoiled rich kid, a brainy nerd, an introverted loner and a rebellious punk - who are brought together on a day-long detention. Despite their original hostilities and a psychotic teacher, the motley crew break the rules, bare their souls and find they have more in common than just attending the same high school(n)

programme.title: Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising
programme.desc: Two years after feuding with a rowdy frat that moved next door to them, young parents Mac (Seth Rogen) and Kelly (Rose Byrne) are about to have their second child and move to a new house. Unfortunately, their attempts to sell their current home hit a snag when a sorority led by a rebellious college student (Chloë Grace Moretz) become their new neighbors. Desperate to get rid of the hard-partying gals, the couple forge an alliance with Teddy (Zac Efron), the former fratboy who tormented them the last time around. Directed by Nicholas Stoller(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: Eligible young people in New York City search for romance while living the single life with their friends(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: Shutdown. A government shutdown forces Selina to furlough some of her staff, but creates an opportunity for Danny Chung. Meanwhile, a damaging story leaks about Selina's ex-husband; and Gary and Jonah get their hands dirty to retrieve some vital information(n)

programme.title: Veep
programme.desc: First Response. Selina preps for an ostensibly flattering interview at the vice president's residence, but is rattled by the reporter's questions(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two hard-partying ladies see a viral video in which unruly brothers plead for dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii, and decide to pose as the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip(n)

programme.title: Rocket Science
programme.desc: Jeffrey Blitz's seriocomedy Rocket Science proves that many a handicap can be overcome, no matter how daunting the obstacle at hand may initially seem. Newcomer Reece Thompson plays Hal Hefner, a 15-year-old high-school student with a minor yet socially alienating (and painful) disability: he stutters uncontrollably. Determined to work through the problem, Hal opts for an extreme route -- he joins the school debating team, which sends him on a headfirst plunge into breakneck speech competitions -- and offers a much-needed boost toward correcting the problem. Blitz, like his onscreen alter ego, struggled with a stammer as a young man -- a disability he eventually surmounted -- which imparted him with a lifelong interest in speech and storytelling(n)

programme.title: Chris Rock: Never Scared
programme.desc: With his pointed insights into race relations and culture, Chris Rock became one of the first comedy superstars of the 21st century. This concert video, Never Scared, is his fourth solo performance originally recorded for the cable network HBO. Recorded during a performance in the nation's capital, Rock touches upon such topics as parenthood, celebrities, and the differences between men and women(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: Packed to the gills with references to mob movies from The Godfather to Casino, the story of an Italian boy who comes to America and becomes entangled with the all-powerful Mafia provides on opportunity for director Jim Abrahams to poke fun at the genre in his distinctive gag-a-minute style using everything from visual puns to verbal acrobatics in his quest to raise a laugh. The gags come thick and fast in this Mafia spoof from the makers of Airplane! and The Naked Gun(n)

Rosie Perez and Rosario Dawson co-star. Directed by Ian Edelman(n)

programme.title: Thunderbirds
programme.desc: Thunderbirds, the science fiction classic of the '60s, showing the adventures of an underground family rescue team led by an ex astronaut, made it to the big screen in the bodies of real actors instead of puppets. Bill Paxton, Brady Corbet and Debora Weston star in this great action story, where the young Alan Tracy finds he has been excluded from the family of heroes. While his father and older brothers keep saving the world over and over, he has to struggle with school problems, without even being able to mention that he is part (though a little from the outside) of the Thunderbirds, themselves(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between an aspiring cop and his seasoned partner (and future brother-in-law) as they pursue a Miami drug lord together with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: Do the Right Thing
programme.desc: A local black community is unhappy that their community is effectively being run by whites. As the heat rises on a hot summer's day in Brooklyn, so the racial tension, which has so far lay dormant under the surface, begins to rise(n)

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: The Lord of Darkness wants to retire but none of his three sons seems good enough for the job. When he decides he will not cede his throne to any of them, the two most powerful ones escape to Earth to create a kingdom for themselves. This action closes the portal filtering sinful souls to Hell and causes Satan to begin withering away. Now it's up to the weak but beloved Nicky to save his dad and the humankind before one of his brothers becomes the new Satan(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Former Saturday Night Live "Weekend Update" co-anchors Tina Fey and Amy Poehler co-star in this baby-fever comedy about a single, career-oriented woman who previously put parenthood on hold, and is forced to hire a surrogate mother when she discovers there is only a one-in-a-million chance that she will be able to get pregnant. Kate Holbrook (Fey) is a 37-year-old business executive who has always put her professional life before her personal life, but these days her biological clock is ticking louder than ever before. As with everything else she has accomplished in life, Kate is determined to have a child on her own terms. Unfortunately for Kate, the chance of her ever becoming pregnant is slim to none. Undaunted, a willful Kate drafts South Philly working-class girl Angie Ostrowiski (Poehler) -- a woman who may just be her polar opposite -- to be a surrogate mother. Subsequently informed by the head of the surrogacy center (Sigourney Weaver) that her surrogate is indeed pregnant, the excited mother-to-be soon purchases every child-rearing book she can find and excitedly begins the nesting process. But life hasn't quit throwing Kate curveballs just yet, because when a pregnant Angie shows up on her doorstep with no place to live, the woman who once thrived on order finds her life descending into chaos. Now, as Kate attempts to transform Angie into the ideal expectant mother, this odd couple will discover that families aren't always biological, but occasionally formed through friendship as well. Writer Michael McCullers, who authored the screenplays for Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me and Undercover Brother in addition to working on Saturday Night Live, makes his feature directorial debut with a self-penned screenplay(n)

programme.desc: John Irving's adaptation of his own novel won him an Oscar for Lasse Hallstrom's drama starring Tobey Maguire and Michael Caine (who also picked up a statue). Maguire is an orphan, mentored by Caine who runs the orphanage he grew up in but Maguire balks at Caine's side-line in illegal abortions. And after young couple Candy and Wally come to Larch for a termination, Homer returns home with them. After Wally is posted overseas on war duty, Homer and Candy become closer at the cider house where they work; but news of a fellow worker's pregnancy leads Homer to re-examine his principles(n)

The film stars Jessica Chastain, Johan Heldenbergh and Daniel Brühl, and is directed by Niki Caro(n)

programme.title: Unlocking the Cage
programme.desc: Animal-rights lawyer Steven Wise and his Nonhuman Rights Project are the focus of this documentary. Wise and his team endeavor to provide limited personhood rights for relatively intelligent animals such as chimpanzees, whales and elephants, which would protect the creatures against captivity and abuse(n)

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc: When two Italian-American boys from New York are falsely accused of murder in a small Alabama town, they call for a lawyer - but the only lawyer they know is their cousin Vinny, who made six attempts before he passed his bar exam(n)

programme.title: Heartbreakers
programme.desc: After the little white lies of Romy and Michele's High School Reunion (1997), director David Mirkin focuses on scheming of a different sort in Heartbreakers. Sigourney Weaver and Jennifer Love Hewitt play Max and Page Conners, a mother and daughter who share everything with each other: relationship advice, hair and makeup hints, and the money they win in costly divorce settlements with rich men. When the film opens, the Conners are putting the finishing touches on conning Dean (Ray Liotta), an auto-body shop owner. When the dust from that scam clears, Page announces she's ready to move away from her mother and set up shop on her own -- but in order to clear an outstanding debt, Max insists they bankrupt one more bachelor together. They settle upon phlegmatic Palm Springs widower William B. Tensy (Gene Hackman), a chain smoker with a heart of gold and a similarly bountiful bank account. Only two things stand in their way: Tensy's Teutonic caretaker Miss Madress (Nora Dunn) and beachfront bartender Jack (Jason Lee), a wry stargazer with whom Page becomes unexpectedly smitten. Heartbreakers is the third collaboration from writers Steven Mazur and Paul Guy, whose previous screwball comedy was 1997's international hit, Liar Liar(n)

programme.title: Ugly

programme.title: The Dark Ages
programme.desc: Examining Europe's grim six-century-long period marked by famine, plague, persecutions and a persistent state of war that began with the fall of Rome in the fifth century A.D., and ended with the first Crusade. Also explored are the historical figures, including Clovis, Charles Martel, Alfred the Great, Charlemagne and St. Benedict, who brought stability and order to civilization during the era. Also explored are the period's political and cultural ideas that would shape Europe in the future(n)

programme.title: Quest for the Lost Ark
programme.desc: Tudor Parfitt, a University of London professor who has been called a "British Indiana Jones" discusses the Biblical Ark of the Covenant, and examines ancient documents and interviews various holy men and politicians in an attempt to trace its history and determine what it looked like. He also theorizes where it is located and explains how he put together clues to come up with his idea(n)

programme.title: Snakes on a Plane
programme.desc: The film that does what it says on the tin. Samuel L Jackson plays Neville Flynn, an FBI agent escorting Sean Jones, a witness to a gangland slaying, from Hawaii to Los Angeles. However, gangster Eddie Kim has secreted crates of venomous serpents in the cargo hold and when they're released, all hell breaks loose. The film earned a reputation for the inclusion of plot lines from blogging fans, including one now infamous line. Despite the novel approach to its production, David R Ellis's film is surprisingly well-acted and tense, with both Julianna Margulies as flight attendant Claire Miller and David Koechner as co-pilot Rick receiving a fair share of the cracking dialogue(n)

programme.title: Kick-Ass
programme.desc: Matthew Vaughn's violent-but-hilarious action movie is a knowing take on the superhero genre, based on Mark Millar and John Romita Jr's comic-book series. Avid comic fan and New York high schooler Dave Lizewski has begun to wonder why his contemporaries are keener on vapid celebrity than wanting to emulate his (super) heroes and try to make the world a better place. Thus Lizewski orders a simply hideous skiing outfit and dons it to become Kick-Ass, scourge of New York's criminals. Well that's the idea, but of course it's his ass that gets kicked when he first tries to put his plan into action. Despite that setback, and spurred on by his desire for a female classmate, he has another go at launching his crime-fighting career. It almost ends as badly as the first one, but this time he's rescued by fellow 'superheroes' Hit Girl and Big Daddy. She's just 11 years old, but has a taste and aptitude for violence that would impress a ninja and swears frequently and badly enough to shock a football fan; he's ever the doting father, gifting her presents of lethal weapons. Together the trio embark on their quest to clean up the city. But waiting in the wings is crime boss Frank D'Amico - and he's no pushover. The film's controversial mix of humour, bad language, sophisticated satire and frequent violence garnered a raft of awards as well as widespread critical acclaim(n)

programme.title: Live International Football
programme.desc: Germany v England (Kick-off 7.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the friendly international at Signal Iduna Park in Dortmund, where England continue their World Cup preparations. Gareth Southgate's men face Lithuania in a qualifier on Sunday as they look to cement their place at the top of Group F, while Germany travel to play Azerbaijan on the same day. The nations last met at this time last year in Berlin, when England staged a remarkable comeback having fallen 2-0 behind, only for goals by Harry Kane, Jamie Vardy and Eric Dier to seal a famous victory. With analysis from Lee Dixon, Ian Wright and Ryan Giggs, and commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Glenn Hoddle.(n)

However, he arouses the police's suspicions when he becomes involved with a teenage tearaway who seems to think Christmas isn't so much about giving and receiving as taking without the owner's permission. programme.title: Goodwood Members Meeting
programme.desc: Dario Franchitti presents highlights of the 75th Members Meeting from Goodwood's historic motor circuit near Chichester, featuring highlights from a number of races.(n)

programme.title: Jaws 3
programme.desc: A shark is captured by divers and put on display in a Florida marine centre, where it ultimately dies. With Sarah Miles and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack congratulates himself on having got the better of Robert in the run-up to the risk-management inquiry, but just when everything seems to be going his way, he goes and causes a road accident . To make matters worse, he's been banned from driving, and shouldn't have been behind the wheel of a car in the first place, which understandably makes it hard for him to keep his mind on his job. Worried and distracted, he makes a grave error of judgement, and suddenly finds himself struggling to cover his tracks. Meanwhile, Sam finds herself on the receiving end of Christine's wrath over a malicious rumour. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack, with a guest appearance by Jane Danson's real-life partner Robert Beck.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: James is offered a new position in India, but Hazel refuses to accompany him. Meanwhile, talk of war shatters the peace of the Bellamy household, and forbidden passions flare between Daisy and Edward.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A seemingly open-and-shut inquiry prompted by a lost suitcase reveals a long-running family feud. Meanwhile, Nick gets involved with a security alert at the village fete. Nostalgic drama, starring Nick Berry and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Dandelion Dead
programme.desc: Herbert Armstrong finds himself under great pressure from business rival Oswald Martin and considers the use of arsenic as a way out of his problems once more. Conclusion of the fact-based drama, starring Michael Kitchen, David Thewlis and Lesley Sharp.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: Robin is bewitched by evil sorceress Lilith, who sends him on a mission to steal the magical silver arrow from Herne's cave. Michael Praed stars.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick vows to resolve a dispute between neighbouring farms, while Kate tries to track down the source of a rare disease. Gina helps Greengrass locate the missing twin of an Australian - with a hefty reward as their motivation.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert's interview with the management consultants doesn't go as planned when it ends up as a painful self-analysis of his ability as a doctor, but although his skills on the wards and in the operating theatre prove otherwise, it's enough to make the beleaguered doc hand in his resignation. Arch-enemy Jack is over the moon about the turn of events and reckons his day couldn't get any better, blissfully unaware that Christine has got her hands on a copy of an X-ray that proves his own shortcomings. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Richard and Hazel open their doors to Belgian refugees while they await news of James, but a language barrier develops and the servants are unimpressed by the guests' ideas of cleanliness.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth falls asleep during a flight from Paris to London, while a female passenger is murdered by a poisoned dart, leaving few clues to the killer's identity. Poirot soon discovers she was a money-lender, which may provide a motive for the killing. The investigation is turned on its head, however, when the victim's illegitimate daughter comes forward to claim the inheritance. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with David Firth, Jenny Downham and John Bleasdale.(n)

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar return as detectives Cassie and Sunny, who find themselves thrown into another historic murder case with the discover of a body. This time it's the perfectly preserved remains of a middle-aged man found in a suitcase in the silt of a London river. As the detectives begin the complicated task of trying to identify the victim, four unconnected people go about their business - Brighton-based lawyer Colin Osborne, paediatric nurse Marion Kelsey, teacher Sara Mahmoud and respected police officer Tessa Nixon - unaware they are about to be dragged into the investigation. Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar star, with Mark Bonnar, Lorraine Ashbourne, Charlie Condou and Wendy Craig.(n)

programme.title: Paranoid
programme.desc: The brutal murder of a local GP in a children's playground appears to be an open-and-shut case when a detectives Bobby Day, Nina Suresh and Alec Wayfield identify the killer on CCTV. But it quickly turns out that there is more to the crime than meets the eye. Conspiracy thriller, starring Robert Glenister, Indira Varma and Dino Fetscher as the investigating trio, with Lesley Sharp, Neil Stuke, John Duttine, Anji Monhindra and Jason Done.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective is summoned to a hotel by a mysterious veiled lady who tells him that her forthcoming marriage is under threat because she is being blackmailed over a love letter. Drama, starring David Suchet and Frances Barber.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Captain Hastings is staying with friends when wealthy heiress Mrs Inglethorp is murdered. Whodunit, starring David Suchet as the Belgian sleuth, with Hugh Fraser, Pauline Moran, Anthony Calf and Philip Jackson.(n)

programme.desc: When the sleuth's dentist is found dead just minutes after he leaves his surgery, Chief Inspector Japp believes it to be suicide - but Poirot has reason to think otherwise and embarks on his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet.(n)

programme.desc: Part one of two. The team is fearful when Buchan is kidnapped. With Miles taunted by an unknown force in the station, Riley's infected hand worsening, and Mansell teetering on the edge of self-destruction, Chandler takes the lead in an investigation into the discovery of a runner's disembowelled body in the sewers. The incident has led some to suspect the return of the Black Swine - a mythical sow that was said to have spawned a litter of mutated feral creatures beneath Victorian London - and others to believe that a subterranean gang of cannibals is running wild. Crime drama, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton.(n)

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part two of two. The hunt is on to find a gang of suspected cannibalistic killers lurking in the sewers before a missing girl becomes the next victim. Crime thriller, starring Rupert Penry-Jones, Phil Davis and Steve Pemberton. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: Steph organises an exotic lingerie event at a local nightclub, but things are unlikely to run smoothly. programme.desc: The case of Keith Reed, who was gunned down on his doorstep. A possible crime of passion was placed in doubt after a surprise discovery, with CCTV footage being called upon to unravel the mystery.(n)

programme.desc: The case of a hairdresser, initially suspected of fatally overdosing on heroin. However, a detective followed a hunch and launched a operation to find her killer.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: National Heritage worker Gillian Sutherland hosts the first dinner party in Inverness, and has high hopes that her guests - emergency-call handler Melissa Kirby, property tycoon David Edes, hair stylist Zarina Ainslie and personal fitness trainer Jamie Tulloch - will appreciate her traditional Scottish menu.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Designer-label fan Melissa Kirby hosts the second dinner party in Inverness, hoping her cooking lessons from one of the city's best chefs will win her the £1,000 prize. However, rival Gillian is unimpressed when she finds out the chef also made the gravy.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Property tycoon and teetotaller David Edes hosts a nautical evening for the third dinner party in Inverness, where his menu of `basic but wholesome food' makes his guests wary. A night of suspicion and hilarity between the diners ensues.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the fourth night of the contest in Inverness, it is hairdresser Zarina Ainslie's turn to host. The fun-loving hopeful needs to live up to her lofty claims of being an amazing cook as her fellow contestants prepare to rate her on the evening.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former professional footballer Jamie Tulloch hosts the final party in Inverness, going to the trouble of ensuring all the ingredients in his chosen dishes are locally sourced. However, it remains to be seen whether his home-grown approach to fine dining will be enough to impress his discerning fellow competitors, and as the night draws to a close, the week's winner is revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a couple look at properties in the Carcassonne area of France and closer to home in the Waveney Valley on the border of Suffolk and Norfolk.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman and Jonnie Irwin help Karin Lorenz and her partner Mike Griffin to search for properties in both south-west France and Pembrokeshire. They want to be able to run a self-catering business from their new home, and also need room for Karin's mum and her dogs.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Lincoln's Inn, London: Called to the Bar.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the crew look for the remains of a 13th-century palace in Lincoln's Inn, London, a building that became the birthplace of the British legal system and was home to Henry III's Lord Chancellor. They also investigate Lincoln's Inn Fields, the biggest public square in central London. Over the course of three days, both sites produce glimpses of some of the defining events that have shaped the city's history.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team join forces with staff from Queen's University in Belfast to excavate a 4,000-year-old monument at Knockdhu on the coast of Co Antrim. Braving the elements in this remote location, they come to appreciate how it has remained undisturbed for so long and uncover evidence of a sophisticated, if warlike, society.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to South Yorkshire to plan to surprise the daughter of an amateur off-road champion by restoring her late mother's Series 1 Land Rover.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A couple who have spent their lives saving stray animals bring in a three-legged cat called Jersey, who has recently become lame in her single back leg. The vet must decide whether the first-ever hip replacement on a three-legged cat is viable. Plus, a Great Dane that is two metres long is given a custom-designed spinal implant, and a Dogue de Bordeaux gets help with elbow dysplasia.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick takes a look at 12-year-old cat Pixie, who has been hit by a car and brought in by owner Diane. The vet believes he can help the animal walk again with the aid of a revolutionary bionic implant. A Great Dane called Ellie has deformed bones and discs pressing down on her spinal cord, but Noel hopes to relieve the dog's pain by placing bone marrow taken from her shoulder into a special scaffolding in her neck, helping the vertebrae fuse together. Meanwhile, receptionist Natalie introduces a new arrival to the team.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of 37-year-old Angelo Mastropietro, as he transforms a damp, dark and abandoned cave in Worcestershire. Having recently been diagnosed with multiple sclerosis, Angelo wants to create a retreat to help him cope with the news and become a 21st century caveman. He has a budget of £100,000 and plans to almost single-handedly carve, cut and drill into the hillside to make the cave comfortable for contemporary living. However, there is no manual for a project of this kind, and the unique challenge soon becomes an obsession.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Zaki, 63, recently underwent a tonsillectomy following a diagnosis of throat cancer, but he has come to A&E after suffering a serious bleed. Doctors try to save 10-month-old baby Amy, who stopped breathing at home, while 21-year-old expectant father Craig appears to have had a miraculous escape after a motocross accident, but has he learnt his lesson?.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Regular team captain Sean Lock is joined by Andrew Flintoff to battle guest captain Bill Bailey and team-mate Roisin Conaty as Jimmy Carr hosts another edition of the comedy panel quiz show mash-up. programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Regular team captain Sean Lock is joined by Liza Tarbuck to battle guest captain Sarah Millican and team-mate Romesh Ranganathan as Jimmy Carr hosts another edition of the comedy panel quiz show mash-up. Susie Dent is ably assisted by Phill Jupitus in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley deals with the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Sam's Mediterranean Kabob Room in Monrovia, California, and within minutes of his arrival, is caught in the crossfire of an argument between the owner, his wife and their children, all of whom are feeling the pressure of working seven days a week. Can the chef save the business and mend the warring family's frayed relationships?.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Irreverent panel show hosted by Jimmy Carr. Team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock are joined by guest panellists Micky Flanagan, Stephen Mangan, Natalie Cassidy and Humphrey Ker to answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to South Yorkshire to plan to surprise the daughter of an amateur off-road champion by restoring her late mother's Series 1 Land Rover.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: University lecturer Amanda Sherratt is keen to impress as she hosts the first dinner party in Lincolnshire, joined by beetroot farmer Chris Moore, theatre student Jack Stone, retail manager Ali Roberts and fitness enthusiast Alex Coxon. Amanda takes a risk with her Japanese-themed evening, which includes a raw fish starter and sumo-wrestling for entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retail manager Ali Roberts hosts the second dinner party in Lincolnshire, confident that her gourmet cuisine and elegant style will win her the £1,000 prize. However, one diner's conversation threatens to cast a shadow over the evening.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Farmer Chris Moore hosts the third dinner party in Lincolnshire, where he plans to wow his guests with a beetroot-themed dinner. However, it is not just his obsession with the vegetable that surprises his diners, as they soon discover he has some hidden talents.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On day four in Lincolnshire, Jack Stone plans to win over his guests with a creative evening during which they will have the chance to make their own food, but the DIY pizzas don't go to plan. Meanwhile, an interesting outfit from Alex Coxon gets the attention of Chris Moore.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: A week of competitive dining in Lincolnshire concludes as self-described proud Geordie Alex Coxon invites fellow contestants into her home, where she invites guests to sample dishes with names favouring her distinctive dialect. However, chaos in the kitchen hinders her chance of securing victory, and as the night draws to a close, the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Graham Hartridge and Maggie Rogers have been together for 18 months and fancy an adventure. He would love to buy a place in the south-west of France, but she is nervous of taking the plunge and would prefer Devon - much closer to family and friends. Jasmine Harman and Jonnie Irwin help with their property search.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman and Jonnie Irwin help couple Diane Rollisson and Robert Somerville, who are searching for a holiday home and trying to decide between locations in Northumberland and Midi-Pyrenees.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Salisbury Cathedral: Buried Bishops and Belfries.
programme.desc: At the turn of the millennium, bones were discovered in an area of Salisbury Cathedral that once housed the personal chapel of the bishop Richard Beauchamp. Tony Robinson and the crew spend three days digging in the grounds, using their expert knowledge to identify the remains and unearth the original bell tower, as well as evidence of the people who constructed the medieval building.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Blythburgh, Suffolk: Skeletons in the Shed.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team investigate a back garden in Blythburgh, Suffolk, where a cupboard full of human skulls was discovered in the potting shed. The archaeologists believe the site could yield the remains of a medieval priory and the body of a Saxon warrior king killed on the nearby marshes. However, the buildings fail to materialise and burials are uncovered in strange locations.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Master mechanic Fuzz Townshend and presenter Tim Shaw head to Berkshire where they hope to surprise the loving owner of a Daimler SP250 Dart by secretly restoring his classic sports car.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick fears the worst when a young cockapoo is hit by a lawnmower, and he faces the challenge of saving as much of its leg as possible. Meanwhile, a seven-year-old labrador struggles with pain in its elbows, and a German Shepherd-Collie cross is suffering with a bulging disk in his spin and hip dysplasia.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Schrodinger the cat is brought in with a shattered thighbone after being hit by a car, and Noel Fitzpatrick prepares to fuse the broken pieces back together in an all-night operation. Plus, English bulldog Lois is put on a strict diet and given an exercise regimen, and an elderly springer spaniel called Flossie, who has lost control of her back legs, arrives at the clinic.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps ballet dancer Nicol and his brother Harry get on the property ladder, exploring potential new homes in north-east London. programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Shooting Stars. The CSIs investigate after a cult commits mass suicide during a meteor shower. Nick confronts his demons from being buried alive(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Gum Drops. The CSIs investigate the disappearance of an entire family. The bloody crime scene leads them to believe they are all dead, but voices Nick hears convince him otherwise(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Secrets and Flies. The CSIs investigate when a single mother's apparent suicide is revealed to be a carefully disguised murder. Grissom faces off in court with a corrupt former colleague, whose entomological findings conflicts with his own(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A Bullet Runs Through It. Part 1 of two. A rookie police officer is killed during a shoot-out with four Hispanic gang members after a high-speed chase. The investigation reveals that the officer may not have been killed by a gang member, but rather by so-called friendly fire. Grissom and his crew search a crime scene that stretches for miles to determine what really happened. Bell: Daniel Bess. Davis: Colby French. Ortega: Nestor Serrano(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A Bullet Runs Through It. Part 1 of two. A rookie police officer is killed during a shoot-out with four Hispanic gang members after a high-speed chase. The investigation reveals that the officer may not have been killed by a gang member, but rather by so-called friendly fire. Grissom and his crew search a crime scene that stretches for miles to determine what really happened. Bell: Daniel Bess. Davis: Colby French. Ortega: Nestor Serrano(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Dog Eat Dog. An obese man is found dead in a Dumpster outside of a restaurant on Thanksgiving and his hands are filled with mashed potatoes. The investigation leads Grissom and Catherine into the world of competitive eating. Across town, Nick and Sara probe the deaths of a husband and wife on the verge of divorce who were apparently attacked by a vicious dog. A golden retriever is found at the scene, but he hardly seems like a killer(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Still Life. Grissom and his team investigate when a 6-year-old boy is reportedly kidnapped from a park where he was playing. The child's mother claims her son was on a swing set shortly before he disappeared. The investigation reveals that the mother is a widow and that she feared her late husband's military father would take the boy from her. Later, Nick is visited by Kelly Gordon, the daughter of the man who abducted Nick and buried him alive(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Werewolves. A man suffering from human werewolf syndrome, a condition that causes excessive hair growth, is found shot to death in his home with a silver bullet in his chest. The police are alerted to the crime by a mysterious call from a phone booth. The investigation reveals that the victim had a large online gambling debt and was recently threatened by the web site's owner(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Daddy's Little Girl. The CSIs investigate the stabbing of a motocross racer who was about to leave town with his girlfriend. Nick comes closer to finding out the truth about his kidnapping(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Kiss-Kiss, Bye-Bye. A waiter is murdered at an exclusive party hosted by a once glamorous Vegas showgirl (Faye Dunaway) who has ties to the mob. The woman believes she was the intended target because she just wrote a tell-all memoir. The case gets personal for Catherine when she learns that her father, Sam Braun, was at the party and is a suspect in the murder(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Killer. A killer murders a man in a run-down apartment building and then is involved in an accident when a young woman smashes into his car at an intersection two blocks from the crime scene. To prevent her from calling the police, he strangles her to death and then drives away. At first, the two crimes are investigated separately, but soon evidence shows they are connected(n)
